items.sourceText: Achebe earned her first degree in education in 1984 from University of Nigeria, Nsukka (UNN).[6] She then earned a master's degree in library science in 1986 from the University of Ibadan and another master's of education degree. She obtained her doctorate in library and information science from University of Nigeria, Nsukka (UNN) in 2000.[7]

targets.targetText: Achebe gba oye akọkọ rẹ ni ẹkọ ni ọdun 1984 lati University of Nigeria, Nsukka (UNN) . [1] Nii Odun 1986 lo gba oye ikawe ni yunifasiti Ibadan ati oye miran. O gba oye fun ile-ikawe ati imọ-jinlẹ alaye lati University of Nigeria, Nsukka (UNN) ni ọdun 2000. [2]

Achebe gba oye akọkọ rẹ ni ẹkọ ni ọdun 1984 lati University of Nigeria, Nsukka (UNN) . [1] Odun 1986 lo gba oye oye oye ikawe ni yunifasiti Ibadan ati oye oye miran. O gba oye oye oye ni ile-ikawe ati imọ-jinlẹ alaye lati University of Nigeria, Nsukka (UNN) ni ọdun 2000. [2]

items.sourceText: Okojie completed her master's degree in Library Science (MLS) from the University of Ibadan, Ibadan, before proceeding to Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria, where she completed her PhD in Library and Information Science in 2012.[6]

targets.targetText: Okojie pari iwe-ẹkọ giga rẹ ni imọ-jinlẹ Library (MLS) lati Ile-ẹkọ giga ti Ilu Ibadan, Ibadan, ṣaaju ki o to lọ si Ile-ẹkọ giga Ahmadu Bello, Zaria, nibiti o ti pari PhD rẹ ni Ile-ikawe ati Imọ Alaye ni ọdun 2012. [1]

Okojie pari iwe-ẹkọ giga rẹ ni imọ-jinlẹ ìkàwé (MLS) lati Ile-ẹkọ giga ti Ilu Ibadan, Ibadan, ki o to lọ si Ile-ẹkọ giga Ahmadu Bello ni Ilu Zaria, nibiti o pari PhD rẹ ni Ile-ikawe ati Imọ Alaye ni ọdun 2012. [1]

items.sourceText: Agozino is a founding member of the international governing council of the Lagos-based think tank the Centre for Democracy and Development.[1] In 2007, Agozino was appointed criminology unit coordinator and professor in sociology at the University of the West Indies, St Augustine, Trinidad and Tobago.[3][4]

targets.targetText: Agozino jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ tó dá sílẹ̀ nínú ìgbìmọ̀ ìgbìmọ̀ ìṣàkóso àgbáyé ti ilé ìrònú tí ó wà ní Èkó, Centre for Democracy and Development . Ni ọdun 2007, Agozino ni a yan oluṣakoso apa iwafin ati olukọ ọjọgbọn ni imọ-ọrọ ni University of West Indies, St Augustine, Trinidad ati Tobago. [1]

Agozino jẹ́ oludasile ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ti o dá ìgbìmọ̀ ìṣàkóso àgbáyé ti ilé ìrònú tí ó wà ní Èkó, Centre for Democracy and Development . Ni ọdun 2007, Agozino ni a yan oluṣakoso apa iwafin ati olukọ ọjọgbọn ni imọ-ọrọ ni University of West Indies, St Augustine, Trinidad ati Tobago. [1]

items.sourceText: Testimony Jaga embarked on his first major media tour in United Kingdom titled "Testimony Jaga Live in UK" in November 2021.[12][13]

targets.targetText: Ijẹrisi Jaga bẹrẹ si irin-ajo media akọkọ akọkọ rẹ ni United Kingdom ti akole ni "Ijẹri Jaga Live ni UK" ni Oṣu kọkanla ọdun 2021. [1] [2]
Jaga bẹrẹ si irin-ajo media akọkọ akọkọ rẹ ni United Kingdom ti akole ni "Ijẹri Jaga Live ni UK" ni Oṣu kọkanla ọdun 2021. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Idowu Adeyemi (born April 4, 1993), popularly known by his stage name Yhemolee, is a Nigerian singer, actor, event host, and social media personality.[1] He gained recognition through his roles in the entertainment industry, He often worked with Asake and collaborated with artists like Chinko Ekun.[2]

targets.targetText: Idowu Adeyemi (ojoibi April 4, 1993), ti gbogbo eniyan mo si pelu oruko ipile re Yhemolee, je olorin Naijiria, oserebirin, agbaagba iṣẹlẹ, ati eniyan media media. [1] O gba idanimọ nipasẹ awọn ipa rẹ ninu ile-iṣẹ ere idaraya, O nigbagbogbo ṣiṣẹ pẹlu Asake ati ifowosowopo pẹlu awọn oṣere bii Chinko Ekun. [2]

Idowu Adeyemi (ojoibi April 4, 1993), ti gbogbo eniyan mo nipa ipele oruko re Yhemolee, je olorin Naijiria, osere, agbalejo iṣẹlẹ, ati eniyan media awujo . [1] O gba idanimọ nipasẹ awọn ipa rẹ ninu ile-iṣẹ ere idaraya, O nigbagbogbo ṣiṣẹ pẹlu Asake ati ifowosowopo pẹlu awọn oṣere bii Chinko Ekun . [2]

items.sourceText: On September 6, 2024, Yhemolee married his long-term partner, Oyin Tayo (Thayour B), in Victoria Island, Lagos.[34][35] The event was attended by guests including Timi Dakolo, Zlatan, Rahaman Jago, Poco Lee, and Soso Soberekon.[36][37] Adeyemi announced on Instagram that he is expecting his first child with his wife.[38]

targets.targetText: Ni Oṣu Kẹsan ọjọ 6, ọdun 2024, Yhemolee fẹ alabaṣepọ rẹ pipẹ, Oyin Tayo (Thayour B), ni Victoria Island, Lagos . [1] [2] Awọn alejo pẹlu Timi Dakolo, Zlatan, Rahaman Jago, Poco Lee, ati Soso Soberekon ti lọ si iṣẹlẹ naa. [3] [4] Adeyemi kede lori ero ayelujara instagram pe oun n reti omo akoko pelu iyawo oun. [5]

Ni Oṣu Kẹsan ọjọ 6, Ọdun 2024, Yhemolee fẹ iyawo ẹlẹgbẹ rẹ pipẹ, Oyin Tayo (Thayour B), ni Victoria Island, Lagos. [1] [2] Awọn alejo ti o wa pẹlu Timi Dakolo, Zlatan, Rahaman Jago, Poco Lee, ati Soso Soberekon ni iṣẹlẹ naa wa. [3] [4] Adeyemi kede lori ero ayelujara instagram pe oun n reti omo akoko pelu iyawo oun. [5]

items.sourceText: Saba Yisa Gideon (born 5 August 1986) is a Nigerian politician representing the Lafiagi/Edu constituency, Edu local government area in the Kwara State House of Assembly.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Saba Yisa Gideon ( 5 August 1986) je oloselu omo orile-ede Naijiria to n soju agbegbe Lafiagi/Edu, ijoba ibile Edu ni ile ìgbìmò asofin ipinle Kwara . [1] [2]
Saba Yisa Gideon (ojoibi 5 August 1986) je oloselu omo Naijiria to n soju agbegbe Lafiagi/Edu, ijoba ibile Edu ni Ile igbimo asofin ipinle Kwara . [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Prior to his emergence as member of the House of Representatives in 2015, he served in various capacities including Chairman, Rivers State Road Maintenance and Rehabilitation Agency, General Manager, Risopalm Oil Estate, and Commissioner of INEC. In 2022, he decamped the All Progressive Congress (APC) to the Social Democratic Party (SDP).[3][4]

targets.targetText: Ki o to farahan gege bi omo ile igbimo asofin lodun 2015, o sise orisirisi ise pelu Alaga, Ajo to n se itoju ati atunse opopona ipinle Rivers, oga agba, Risopalm Estate Epo, ati Komisana fun ajo INEC. Ni ọdun 2022, o fi ẹgbẹ oselu All Progressive Congress (APC) pada si Social Democratic Party (SDP). [1] [2]

Ki o to dibo wọlé bi omo ile igbimo asofin lodun 2015, o sise orisirisi ise pelu Alaga ibile, Ajo to n se itoju ati atunse opopona ipinle Rivers, oga agba, Risopalm Estate Epo, ati Komisana fun ajo INEC. Ni ọdun 2022, o fi ẹgbẹ oselu All Progressive Congress (APC) pada si Social Democratic Party (SDP). [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Emeka Obioma is a Nigerian politician. He currently serves as the Chief Whip of the Abia State House of Assembly representing Umuahia South State Constituency. He was elected into office on 29 May 2023.[1]

targets.targetText: Emeka Obioma je olóṣèlú ọmọ Nàìjíríà. Lọwọlọwọ o n ṣiṣẹ gẹgẹbi Olóyè Whip ti Ile-igbimọ Aṣofin Ipinle Abia ti o nsoju àgbègbè Umuahia South State Constituency. O ti dibo si ọfiisi ni ọjọ 29 Oṣu Karun 2023. [1]

Emeka Obioma je oloselu omo Naijiria. Lọwọlọwọ o n ṣiṣẹ gẹgẹbi Oloye Whip ti Ile-igbimọ Aṣofin Ipinle Abia ti o nsoju agbegbe Umuahia South State Constituency. O ti dibo si ọfiisi ni ọjọ 29 Oṣu Karun 2023. [1]

items.sourceText: Clinton Christopher Nkemjika Amadi is a Nigerian politician and a lawmaker. He is currently a member of the Imo State House of Assembly under the platform of Labour Party representing Owerri Municipal council.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Clinton Christopher Nkemjika Amadi jẹ oloselu Naijiria ati aṣofin. Lọwọlọwọ o jẹ ọmọ ile-igbimọ aṣofin ipinlẹ Imo labẹ ipilẹ ẹgbẹ Labour Party ti o nsoju igbimọ Municipal Owerri . [1] [2]
Clinton Christopher Nkemjika Amadi jẹ oloselu Naijiria ati aṣofin. Lọwọlọwọ o jẹ ọmọ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asofin ìpínlè Imo, labẹ ẹgbẹ Labour Party ti o nsoju igbimọ Municipal Owerri . [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Nnabuife began her career with the Abuja Municipal Area Council (AMAC) where she was appointed as  Principal Information Executive. She later plights her trade in real estate busine and eventually ventured into politics in 2019 and she was defeated. In 2023, she eventually won Orumba North/Orumba South  under the same party, Young Progressives Party.[4][2][3]

targets.targetText: Nnabuife bere ise re pelu Abuja Municipal Area Council (AMAC) nibi ti won ti yan an gege bi Alase Alaye pataki. Lẹhinna o dojukọ iṣowo rẹ ni ile-iṣẹ ohun-ini gidi ati nikẹhin o ṣe iselu ni ọdun 2019 ati pe o ṣẹgun. Ni ọdun 2023, o bori Orumba North/Orumba South nikẹhin ẹgbẹ kan naa, Young Progressives Party. [1] [2] [3]

Nnabuife bere ise re pelu Abuja Municipal Area Council (AMAC) níbí ti won ti yàn an gẹ́gẹ́ bi Aláṣẹ pàtàki. Lẹhinna o dójú kọ iṣowo rẹ ni ile-iṣẹ ohun-ini gidi ati nikẹhin o ṣe ìṣèlú ni ọdun 2019 ati pe o ṣẹgun. Ni ọdun 2023, o bori Orumba North/Orumba South nikẹhin ẹgbẹ kan naa, Young Progressives Party. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: On September 19, 2020, during the governorship election in Edo State, Abdulganiyu Audu was accused of certificate forgery by Mr. Osagie Ize-Iyamu, the ADP governorship candidate, who submitted the allegations to the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC).[3][4]

targets.targetText: Ni Oṣu Kẹsan ọjọ 19, ọdun 2020, lakoko idibo gomina ni Ipinle Edo, Abdulganiyu Audu ni iwe-ẹri ayederu kan nipasẹ Ọgbẹni Osagie Ize-Iyamu, oludije fun ipo gomina ADP, ti o fi ẹsun naa ranṣẹ si Igbimọ Electoral National Independent (INEC). [1] [2]

Ni Oṣu Kẹsan ọjọ 19, ọdun 2020, lakoko idibo gómìnà ni Ìpínlẹ̀ Edo, Abdulganiyu Audu ni iwe-ẹri ayédèrú kan nipasẹ Ọgbẹni Osagie Ize-Iyamu, oludije fun ipo gómìnà ADP, ti o fi ẹsun naa ranṣẹ si Igbimọ Electoral National Independent (INEC). [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Bashir Idris Nadabo is a Nigerian politician from Katsina State, who represented the Funtua/Dandume constituency in the House of Representatives at the National Assembly from 2003 to 2007. He served under the platform of the All Nigeria Peoples Party (ANPP).[1][2]

targets.targetText: Bashir Idris Nadabo je oloselu omo Naijiria lati ipinle Katsina, to soju agbegbe Funtua / Dandume ni ile igbimo asofin ni ile igbimo asofin agba lati 2003 si 2007. Ó sìn lábẹ́ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú All Nigeria Peoples Party (ANPP). [1] [2]

Bashir Idris Nadabo je oloselu ọmọ Nàìjíríà lati ìpínlè Katsina, to soju agbegbe Funtua / Dandume ni ilé ìgbìmò asofin ni ile igbimo aṣòfin agba lati 2003 si 2007. Ó sìn lábẹ́ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú All Nigeria Peoples Party (ANPP). [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Gabriel was born on November 15, 1970, in Isan-Ekiti, Ekiti State. He attended St. Paul's Anglican Primary School in Isan Ekiti from 1976 to 1982. He obtained his Ordinary and Higher National Diploma from Ondo State Polytechnic (now Rufus Giwa Polytechnic) between 1993 and 1997. He is also an alumnus of Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba, Ondo State, class of 1999, and holds a Master of Business Administration (MBA) in Finance, which he earned in 2002.[5]

targets.targetText: A bi Gabriel ni Oṣu kọkanla ọjọ 15, ọdun 1970, ni Isan-Ekiti, Ipinle Ekiti . O lọ si St Paul's Anglican Primary School ni Isan Ekiti lati ọdun 1976 si 1982. O gba iwe-ẹkọ giga ti orílè-èdè Nàìjíríà ti Ondo State Polytechnic (eyiti o jẹ Rufus Giwa Polytechnic) láàrin ọdun 1993 si 1997. O tun jẹ ọmọ ile-iwe giga ti Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba, Ìpínlẹ̀ Ondo, kilasi 1999, o si ni Master of Business Administration (MBA) ni Isuna, eyiti o gba ni 2002. [1]

A bi Gabriel ni Oṣu kọkanla ọjọ 15, ọdun 1970, ni Isan-Ekiti, Ipinle Ekiti . O lọ si St Paul's Anglican Primary School ni Isan Ekiti lati ọdun 1976 si 1982. O gba iwe-ẹkọ giga ti orilẹ-ede deede ati giga lati Ondo State Polytechnic (eyiti o jẹ Rufus Giwa Polytechnic) laarin ọdun 1993 si 1997. O tun jẹ ọmọ ile-iwe giga ti Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba, Ipinle Ondo, kilasi 1999, o si ni Master of Business Administration (MBA) ni Isuna, eyiti o gba ni 2002. [1]

items.sourceText: Danbaba was born on 13th February 1978 in BabadabeYaralea, Kaiama Local Government area of Kwara State Nigeria. He attended Kwara State Polytechnic for his IJMB ‘A’ in 1995 and Usman Danfodio University for his bachelor's degree in Political Science in 2000.[4][2]

targets.targetText: A bi Danbaba ni ọjọ kẹtàlá osu kejìlá ọdún 1978 ni BabadabeYaralea, àgbègbè Kaiama Local Government ni Ipinle Kwara Nigeria . O lọ si Kwara State Polytechnic fun IJMB 'A' rẹ ni ọdun 1995 ati University Usman Danfodio fun òye rẹ ni imọ-ọrọ olóṣèlú ni ọdun 2000. [1] [2]

A bi Danbaba ni ojo ketala osu kejila odun 1978 ni BabadabeYaralea, agbegbe Kaiama Local Government ni Ipinle Kwara Nigeria . O lọ si Kwara State Polytechnic fun IJMB 'A' rẹ ni ọdun 1995 ati University Usman Danfodio fun oye oye rẹ ni imọ-ọrọ oloselu ni ọdun 2000. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Abolarin was born on 23 March 1976 in Odo-Itan, Ekiti Local Government area Kwara State Nigeria. He studied accounting at Federal Polytechnic, Offa for his National Diploma and Kwara State Polytechnic for his Higher National Diploma in the same field which he completed in 2011.[1][4]

targets.targetText: A bi Abolarin ni ọjọ́ ketalelogun osù kẹta ọdun 1976 ni Odo-Itan, nijoba ibile Ekiti agbegbe Kwara State Nigeria. O kọ ẹkọ iṣiro ni Federal Polytechnic, Offa fun Iwe-ẹkọ giga ti orilẹ-ede ati Kwara State Polytechnic fun Iwe-ẹkọ giga giga ti orilẹ-ede ni aaye kanna ti o pari ni 2011. [1] [2]

A bi Abolarin ni ojo ketalelogun osu keta odun 1976 ni Odo-Itan, nijoba ibile Ekiti agbegbe Kwara State Nigeria. O kọ ẹkọ iṣiro ni Federal Polytechnic, Offa fun Iwe-ẹkọ giga ti orilẹ-ede ati Kwara State Polytechnic fun Iwe-ẹkọ giga giga ti orilẹ-ede ni aaye kanna ti o pari ni 2011. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Olushola Odetundun is a Nigerian politician representing the Irepodun constituency, Irepodun local government area in the Kwara State House of Assembly.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Olushola Odetundun je oloselu omo Naijiria to n soju agbegbe Irepodun, ijoba ibile Irepodun ni ile igbimo asofin ipinle Kwara. [1] [2]
Olushola Odetundun je olóṣèlú ọmọ orílè-èdè Naijiria to n sójú àgbègbè Irepodun, ijoba ìbílè Irepodun ni ile igbimo asofin ipinle Kwara. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Yusuf Atoyebi Musa is a Nigerian politician representing the Odo-Ogun constituency, Oyun local government area in the 9th and 10th Assembly, he served as the Chief Whip of the 9th Assembly of the Kwara State House of Assembly between 2019 to 2023.[1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Yusuf Atoyebi Musa je olóṣèlú ọmọ orilẹ-ede Nàìjíríà to n sójú àgbègbè Odo-Ogun, ìjọba ibile Oyun ni ile igbimo asofin 9th ati 10th, o je olori agba ile igbimo aṣòfin kẹsàn-án ti ile ìgbìmọ̀ asofin ipinle Kwara laarin odun 2019 si 2023. [1] [2] [3]

Yusuf Atoyebi Musa je oloselu omo orile-ede Naijiria to n soju agbegbe Odo-Ogun, ijoba ibile Oyun ni ile igbimo asofin 9th ati 10th, o je olori agba ile igbimo asofin kesan ti ile igbimo asofin ipinle Kwara laarin odun 2019 si 2023. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Awodiji was born on 12 February 1959 in Lagos State Nigeria with his origin from Ifelodun Local Government Area of kwara state. He studied Performing Arts at the Lagos State University Ojo, Lagos and previously attended Government Secondary School, Bauchi and Oro Grammar School, Oro in Kwara State.[1]

targets.targetText: A bi Awodiji ni ọjọ kejìlá osu kejì ọdun 1959 ni Ìpínlẹ̀ Eko Nàìjíríà ti o ti wa lati ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Ifelodun ni ipinle kwara . O ko eko Performing Arts ni Lagos State University Ojo, Lagos, o si lo tẹ́lẹ̀ eko ijọba Secondary School, Bauchi ati Oro Grammar School, Oro ni Ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara. [1]

A bi Awodiji ni ojo kejila osu keji odun 1959 ni Ipinle Eko Naijiria ti o ti wa lati ijoba ibile Ifelodun ni ipinle kwara . O ko eko Performing Arts ni Lagos State University Ojo, Lagos, o si lo tele eko ijoba Secondary School, Bauchi ati Oro Grammar School, Oro ni ipinle Kwara. [1]

items.sourceText: Barrister Olufemi Lanlehin joined the law firm of the erudite lawyer and social critic, Chief Gani Fawehinmi SAN in July 1978, where he was until August 1980. In August 1980, he established his own law firm, Olufemi Lanlehin & Co and was appointed a Notary Public and Commissioner for Oaths in August 1980.[1]

targets.targetText: Barrister Olufemi Lanlehin darapọ mo ile ise aṣòfin ti agbẹjọ́rò àgbà ati alariwisi awujo, Olóyè Gani Fawehinmi SAN ni osu keje odun 1978, nibiti o wa titi di osu kejo odun 1980. Ni Oṣu Kẹjọ Ọdun 1980, o da ile-iṣẹ aṣofin tirẹ silẹ, Olufemi Lanlehin & Co ati pe o yan Olufemi Lanlehin & Co ati pe o jẹ Alákóso Agba ati Komisona fun Awọn ibura ni Oṣu Kẹjọ ọdun 1980. [1]

Barrister Olufemi Lanlehin darapo mo ile ise amofin ti agbejoro agba ati alariwisi awujo, Oloye Gani Fawehinmi SAN ni osu keje odun 1978, nibiti o wa titi di osu kejo odun 1980. Ni Oṣu Kẹjọ Ọdun 1980, o da ile-iṣẹ aṣofin tirẹ silẹ, Olufemi Lanlehin & Co ati pe o yan Olufemi Lanlehin & Co ati pe o jẹ Alakoso Agba ati Komisona fun Awọn ibura ni Oṣu Kẹjọ ọdun 1980. [1]

items.sourceText: Lanlehin was the gubernatorial candidate of the African Democratic Congress (ADC) for the 2019 Oyo State Gubernatorial elections.[1][2] He lost to Peoples Democratic Party's (PDP) Oluwaseyi Makinde[7]

targets.targetText: Lanlehin ni oludije gomina fun ẹgbẹ oṣelu African Democratic Congress (ADC) fun idibo gomina ipinlẹ Ọyọ lọdun 2019. [1] [2] O padanu ninu egbe Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Oluwaseyi Makinde [3]
Lanlehin ni oludije gomina fun ẹgbẹ oṣelu African Democratic Congress (ADC) fun idibo gómìnà ìpínlè Ọyọ lọdun 2019. [1] [2] O padanu ninu egbe Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Oluwaseyi Makinde [3]

items.sourceText: Kyari was born on 15 January (1963) to Brigadier Abba Kyari, a former military governor of North Central State from 1967 to 1975.[7]

targets.targetText: A bi Kyari ni ọjọ 15 Oṣu Kini (1963) si Brigadier Abba Kyari, gómìnà ológun tẹlẹ ti Àríwá Central State lati 1967 si 1975. [1]
A bi Kyari ni ọjọ 15 Oṣu Kini (1963) si Brigadier Abba Kyari, gomina ologun tẹlẹ ti Ariwa Central State lati 1967 si 1975. [1]

items.sourceText: Reid died in London on 24 February 1909, and was buried at Bramshaw, Hampshire. He married, on 6 July 1863, Georgina, daughter of C. J. Hill of Halifax, Nova Scotia.

targets.targetText: Reid ku ni Ilu Lọndọnu ni ọjọ 24 Kínní ọdun 1909, a si sin i si Bramshaw, Hampshire. O ṣe igbeyawo, ni 6 Keje 1863, Georgina, ọmọbinrin CJ Hill ti Halifax, Nova Scotia.
Reid kù si Ìlù Lọndọnu ni ọjọ kẹrìnlá lógún osu Kínní ọdun 1909, a si sin i si Bramshaw, Hampshire. O ṣe igbeyawo, ni 6 Keje 1863, Georgina, ọmọbinrin CJ Hill ti Halifax, Nova Scotia.

items.sourceText: Emeka Atuma hails from Ikwuano Local Government Area of Abia State, Nigeria. He obtained a degree in Engineering from the University of Calabar.[3]

targets.targetText: Emeka Atuma wá láti agbègbè Ikwuano Local Government ni Abia State, Nàìjíríà. O gbà oye imọ-ẹrọ láti Ile-ẹkọ giga ti Calabar . [1]
Emeka Atuma wa lati agbegbe Ikwuano Local Government ni Abia State, Nigeria. O gba oye imọ-ẹrọ lati Ile-ẹkọ giga ti Calabar . [1]

items.sourceText: In December 2024, President Bola Tinubu appointed Atuma as chairman of the South East Development Commission (SEDC), but he was replaced by Emeka Nworgu less than 24 hours after the appointment.[8][9]

targets.targetText: Ni osu kejila, odun 2024, Aare Bola Tinubu yan Atuma gege bi alaga ajo South East Development Commission (SEDC) sugbon Emeka Nworgu ropo e ni ko tii ju wakati merinlelogun leyin iyansipo naa. [1] [2]

Ni osu kejila, ọdun 2024, Aare Bola Tinubu yan Atuma gẹ́gẹ́ bi alága ajo South East Development Commission (SEDC) ṣùgbọ́n Emeka Nworgu ropo e ni ko tii ju wákàtí mẹ́rìnlélógún leyin iyansipo naa. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: In October 2024, six months after his suspension in May 2024, Okogbe was reinstated by the Edo State House of Assembly following an allegation that he had planted charms in the assembly complex.[2][3][4]

targets.targetText: Ni Oṣu Kẹwa Ọdun 2024, oṣu mẹfa lẹhin idaduro rẹ ni May 2024, Ile-igbimọ Aṣofin Ìpínlẹ̀ Edo da Okogbe pada sipo lẹhin ẹsun kan pe o ti gbìn awọn ogún si ile apejọ naa. [1] [2] [3]
Ni Oṣu Kẹwa Ọdun 2024, oṣu mẹfa lẹhin idaduro rẹ ni May 2024, Ile-igbimọ Aṣofin Ipinle Edo da Okogbe pada sipo lẹhin ẹsun kan pe o ti gbin awọn ẹwa si ile apejọ naa. [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Abayomi Abolaji is a Nigerian educator and administrator from Lagos State, Nigeria. He was born on 19 December 1964 to Mr. Olowookere and Mrs. Nimat Abolaji. He graduated from Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria, where he studied Social Studies in the Education Degree Programme. He later earned a Master's Degree in Education Planning from the National Open University of Nigeria.[1]

targets.targetText: Abayomi Abolaji jẹ olukọni ati alábòójútó ọmọ Naijiria lati Ìpínlẹ̀ Eko, Nigeria . Won bi ni ọjọ kọkàndínlógún osu kejìlá ọdún 1964 si Ọgbẹni Olowookere ati Iyaafin Nimat Abolaji. O kawe gboye ni Yunifasiti Ahmadu Bello, Zaria, nibi ti o ti ka eko nípa Social Studies ni eto Degree Education. Lẹhinna o gba oye oye gíga ni eto ẹkọ lati National Open University of Nigeria. [1]

Abayomi Abolaji jẹ olukọni ati alabojuto ọmọ Naijiria lati Ipinle Eko, Nigeria . Won bi ni ojo kokandinlogun osu kejila odun 1964 si Ogbeni Olowookere ati Iyaafin Nimat Abolaji. O kawe gboye ni Yunifasiti Ahmadu Bello, Zaria, nibi ti o ti ka eko nipa Social Studies ni eto Degree Education. Lẹhinna o gba oye oye giga ni Eto eto ẹkọ lati National Open University of Nigeria. [1]

items.sourceText: Abubakar Abdullai Ahmad is a Nigerian politician born in 1968 in Sokoto State, Nigeria. He holds a degree in Civil Law.[1] In 2019, he was elected to serve as a member of the House of Representatives in the Sokoto National Assembly, representing the Sokoto North/Sokoto South constituency.[2][3]

targets.targetText: Abubakar Abdullai Ahmad je olóṣèlú ọmọ orile-ede Nàìjíríà ti a bi ni ọdún 1968 ni Ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto ni Naijiria . O gba oye ni Ofin Ilu . [1] Ni ọdun 2019, o jẹ ọmọ ẹgbẹ ti Ile-igbimọ Aṣoju ni Ile-igbimọ Asofin Sokoto, ti o nsoju àgbègbè Sokoto North/Sokoto South. [2] [3]

Abubakar Abdullai Ahmad je oloselu omo orile-ede Naijiria ti a bi ni odun 1968 ni Ipinle Sokoto ni Naijiria . O gba oye ni Ofin Ilu . [1] Ni ọdun 2019, o jẹ ọmọ ẹgbẹ ti Ile-igbimọ Aṣoju ni Ile-igbimọ Asofin Sokoto, ti o nsoju agbegbe Sokoto North/Sokoto South. [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Abubakar Amuda-kannike is a Nigerian politician from Kwara State, Nigeria. He represented the Ilorin East/Ilorin South constituency as a member of the House of Representatives, National Assembly, from 2015 to 2019.[1] He also served as a Commissioner for Works and Transport in Kwara State.[2]

targets.targetText: Abubakar Amuda-kannike je oloselu omo orile-ede Naijiria lati ipinle Kwara ni Naijiria . O ṣe aṣoju agbegbe Ila-oorun / Ilorin South gẹgẹbi ọmọ ẹgbẹ ti Ile-igbimọ Aṣoju, Apejọ Orilẹ-ede, lati 2015 si 2019. [1] Bakan naa lo tun je Komisana fun ise ati oko ni ipinle Kwara. [2]

Abubakar Amuda-kannike je olóṣèlú ọmọ orile-ede Nàìjíríà lati Ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara . O ṣe aṣoju àgbègbè Ila-oorun / Ilorin South gẹgẹbi ọmọ ẹgbẹ ti Ile-igbimọ Aṣoju, Apejọ Orilẹ-ede, lati ọdún 2015 si 2019. [1] Bákan naa lo tun je Komisana fun ise ati oko ni Ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara. [2]

items.sourceText: David Abel Fuoh (b. 15 April 1968) is a Nigerian politician representing the Gashaka/Kurmi/Sardauna Federal Constituency of Taraba State in the House of Representatives. He is a member of the All Progressives Congress (APC).[1][2][3][4]

targets.targetText: David Abel Fuoh (b. 15 April 1968) je olóṣèlú ọmọ orílè-èdè Naijiria ti o nsójú àgbègbè Gashaka / Kurmi / Sardauna ti Ìpínlẹ̀ Taraba ni Ile Awọn Aṣoju . O je omo egbe All Progressives Congress (APC). [1] [2] [3] [4]

David Abel Fuoh (b. 15 April 1968) je oloselu omo orile-ede Naijiria ti o nsoju agbegbe Gashaka / Kurmi / Sardauna Federal Constituency ti Ipinle Taraba ni Ile Awọn Aṣoju . O je omo egbe All Progressives Congress (APC). [1] [2] [3] [4]

items.sourceText: Antjie Krog (born 1952) is a South African writer and academic, best known for her Afrikaans poetry, her reporting on the Truth and Reconciliation Commission, and her 1998 book Country of My Skull. In 2004, she joined the Arts faculty of the University of the Western Cape as Extraordinary Professor.[1]

targets.targetText: Antjie Krog (ti a bi 1952) jẹ olukọwe ati oluko agba omo ile South Africa ti o gbajumo fun ewi Afrikaans rẹ, ijabọ rẹ lori Otitọ ati Igbimọ Ilaja, ati iwe 1998 rẹ Orilẹ-ede ti Skull mi . Ni ọdun 2004, o darapọ mọ Oluko Arts ti Ile-ẹkọ giga ti Western Cape gẹgẹbi Ọjọgbọn Alailẹgbẹ. [1]

Antjie Krog (ti a bi 1952) jẹ onkọwe South Africa kan ati ẹkọ, ti o mọ julọ fun ewi Afrikaans rẹ, ijabọ rẹ lori Otitọ ati Igbimọ Ilaja, ati iwe 1998 rẹ Orilẹ-ede ti Skull mi . Ni ọdun 2004, o darapọ mọ Oluko Arts ti Ile-ẹkọ giga ti Western Cape gẹgẹbi Ọjọgbọn Alailẹgbẹ. [1]

items.sourceText: The Eastern Mediterranean University (EMU; Turkish: Doğu Akdeniz Üniversitesi) is a public university in Northern Cyprus, was established in 1979, led by Onay Fadıl Demirciler, who was then the Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education.[2] Initially founded as a technology-focused higher-education institution for Turkish Cypriots, it was granted state university status in 1986. The university's campus is situated within the city of Famagusta.

targets.targetText: Ile-ẹkọ giga Mẹditarenia ti Ila-oorun jẹ ile-ẹkọ giga ti gbogbo eniyan ni Ariwa Cyprus, ti iṣeto ni ọdun 1979, nipasẹ Onay Fadıl Demirciler, ẹniti o jẹ Akọwe Alábòójútó ti Ile-iṣẹ ti Ẹkọ nígbà náà. [1] Ni ibẹrẹ ti o da bi ile-ẹkọ eto-ẹkọ giga ti idojukọ-imọ-ẹrọ fun Awọn Cypriots Turki, o fun ni ipò ile-ẹkọ giga ti ipinlẹ ni ọdun 1986. Ile-iwe giga ti ile-ẹkọ giga wa laarin ilu Famagusta .

Ile-ẹkọ giga Mẹditarenia ti Ila-oorun ( EMU ; Turkish ) jẹ ile-ẹkọ giga ti gbogbo eniyan ni Ariwa Cyprus, ti iṣeto ni ọdun 1979, nipasẹ Onay Fadıl Demirciler, ẹniti o jẹ Akọwe Alabojuto ti Ile-iṣẹ ti Ẹkọ nigbana. [1] Ni ibẹrẹ ti o da bi ile-ẹkọ eto-ẹkọ giga ti idojukọ-imọ-ẹrọ fun Awọn Cypriots Turki, o fun ni ipo ile-ẹkọ giga ti ipinlẹ ni ọdun 1986. Ile-iwe giga ti ile-ẹkọ giga wa laarin ilu Famagusta .

items.sourceText: Olusola Bandele Oyewole (Born, 30 September 1955 in Kaduna State, Nigeria) is a Nigerian professor of Food science and technology, educational administrator, and former vice chancellor of University of Agriculture, Abeokuta [1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Olusola Bandele Oyewole (Abibi, Oṣu Kẹsan ọjọ kẹsan ọjọ 1955 ni Ipinle Kaduna , Nigeria ) jẹ olukọni ti Nigeria ti Imọ imọ-ẹrọ ati imọ-ẹrọ , olutọju ẹkọ, ati oludari Alakoso giga ti University of Agriculture, Abeokuta [1] [2] [3]

Olusola Bandele Oyewole (Abini, Oṣu Kẹsan ogbon ọjọ, 1955 ni Ipinle Kaduna , Nigeria) jẹ olukọni ti Nigeria ti Imọ imọ-ẹrọ ati imọ-ẹrọ , olutọju ẹkọ, ati oludari Alakoso giga ti University of Agriculture, Abeokuta [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: The Mawjoudin Queer Film Festival is an annual film festival in Tunisia celebrating the LGBT community. It began in 2018, as the first queer film festival in the country.[1][2] It is organized by Mawjoudin, a Tunisian NGO, whose name translates to "We Exist".[1] The focus is on queer identities, especially in people from the Global South.[3]

targets.targetText: Mawjoudin Queer Film Festival jẹ ajọyọyọyọ ọdun kan ni orilẹ-ede Tunisia nṣe ayẹyẹ agbegbe LGBT. O bẹrẹ ni ọdun 2018, gẹgẹbi iṣaju fiimu ajọyọ ni akọkọ ni orilẹ-ede [1] [2] O ti ṣeto nipasẹ Mawjoudin , NGO Tunisia, ti orukọ rẹ tumọ si "A wa be". [1] Idojukọ naa wa lori awọn idinudọpọ dede, paapaa ni awọn eniyan lati Agbaye Gusu . [3]

Majẹmu Festival Fiimu ti Mawjoudin jẹ ajọyọyọyọ ọdun kan ni Tunisia nṣe ayẹyẹ agbegbe LGBT. O bẹrẹ ni ọdun 2018, gẹgẹbi iṣaju fiimu ajọyọ ni akọkọ ni orilẹ-ede. [1] [2] O ti ṣeto nipasẹ Mawjoudin , NGO Tunisia, ti orukọ rẹ tumọ si "A wa". [1] Idojukọ naa wa lori awọn idinudọpọ dede, paapaa ni awọn eniyan lati Agbaye Gusu . [3]

items.sourceText: According to Bogomilism, the crucifixion was an attempt by Lucifer to destroy Jesus, while the earthly Jesus was regarded as a prophet, Jesus himself was an immaterial being that can not be killed. Accordingly, Lucifer failed and Jesus' sufferings on the cross were only an illusion.[223]

targets.targetText: Ni ibamu si Bogomilism, àgbélébù jẹ igbiyanju Lucifer lati pa Jésù run, nigba ti a pe Jésù ni ilẹ aiye bi wolii, Jésù tikararẹ jẹ ohun ti ko ni iyipada ti a ko le pa. Bakannaa, Lucifer kuna ati awọn ijiya Jésù lori àgbélébù jẹ asan. [1]

Ni ibamu si Bogomilism, agbelebu jẹ igbiyanju Lucifer lati pa Jesu run, nigba ti a pe Jesu ni ilẹ aiye bi wolii, Jesu tikararẹ jẹ ohun ti ko ni iyipada ti a ko le pa. Bakannaa, Lucifer kuna ati awọn ijiya Jesu lori agbelebu jẹ asan. [1]

items.sourceText: The Groupe d'information et de soutien des immigrés) is a French non-profit organization for human rights created in 1972 to protect the legal and political rights of foreigners and immigrants and to advocate freedom of movement across borders.

targets.targetText: Ile-iṣẹ Groupe d'information et de soutien des immigrés ) jẹ agbari-ọrọ ti ko ni èrè ti France fun awọn ẹtọ eda eniyan ti a dá ni ọdun 1972 lati dabobo ẹtọ awọn ofin ati ẹtọ ẹtọ ti awọn ajeji ati awọn aṣikiri ati lati nija fun ominira iyipo ni awọn aala.

Ile-iṣẹ Alaye ati Support ti awọn aṣikiri ) jẹ agbari-ọrọ ti ko ni èrè ti France fun awọn ẹtọ eda eniyan ti a dá ni ọdun 1972 lati dabobo ẹtọ awọn ofin ati ẹtọ ẹtọ ti awọn ajeji ati awọn aṣikiri ati lati nija fun ominira iyipo ni awọn aala.

items.sourceText: Harlem is a neighborhood in the northern section of the New York City borough of Manhattan. It is bounded roughly by Frederick Douglass Boulevard, St. Nicholas Avenue, and Morningside Park on the west; the Harlem River and 155th Street on the north; Fifth Avenue on the east; and Central Park North on the south. The greater Harlem area encompasses several other neighborhoods and extends west to the Hudson River, north to 155th Street, east to the East River, and south to Martin Luther King, Jr., Boulevard, Central Park, and East 96th Street.

targets.targetText: Harlem ni a adugbo ni ariwa apakan ti awọn New York City romo ti Manhattan . O ti ni ihamọ ni aijọju nipasẹ Frederick Douglass Boulevard, St. Nicholas Avenue, ati Morningside Park ni iwọ-oorun; Odò Harlem ati Opopona 155 ni ariwa; Fifth Avenue ni ila-oorun; ati Central Park North ni guusu. Agbegbe Harlem ti o tobi ju ọpọlọpọ awọn agbegbe miiran lọ o si fa iha iwọ-oorun si Odò Hudson, ariwa si 155th Street, ila-oorun si Odo East, ati guusu si Martin Luther King, Jr., Boulevard, Central Park, ati East 96th Street .

Harlem jẹ́ adugbò ni ariwa apakan ti ìlú New York City nínu ìlẹ̀ Manhattan . O ti ni ihamọ ni aijọju nipasẹ Frederick Douglass Boulevard, St. Nicholas Avenue, ati Morningside Park ni iwọ-oorun; Odò Harlem ati Opopona 155 ni ariwa; Fifth Avenue ni ila-oorun; ati Central Park North ni guusu. Agbegbe Harlem ti o tobi ju ọpọlọpọ awọn agbegbe miiran lọ o si fa iha iwọ-oorun si Odò Hudson, ariwa si 155th Street, ila-oorun si Odo East, ati guusu si Martin Luther King, Jr., Boulevard, Central Park, ati East 96th Street .

items.sourceText: In 2004, Ojo started producing her own films. Ojo's first production was Bolutife, after which she made Bofeboko, Ololufe, Esan and Okunkun Biribiri.[1] She also divorced her husband before her fame started.

targets.targetText: Ni ọdun 2004, Ojo bẹrẹ si ṣe awọn fiimu tirẹ. Ojo akọkọ ti iṣelọpọ ni Bolutife, lẹhin eyi o ṣe Bofeboko, Ololufe, Esan ati Okunkun Biribiri . [1] O tun kọ ọkọ rẹ silẹ ṣaaju ki okiki rẹ bẹrẹ.
Ni ọdun 2004, Ojo bẹrẹ si ṣe awọn fiimu tirẹ. Boluwatife ni ise akoko ti Ojo gbe jade , lẹhin eyi o ṣe Bofeboko, Ololufe, Esan ati Okunkun Biribiri . [1] O tun kọ ọkọ rẹ silẹ ṣaaju ki okiki rẹ bẹrẹ.

items.sourceText: In 1993, Henshaw auditioned for the lead role in the movie When the Sun Sets and was won the role. This was her first appearance in a major Nollywood movie.[1] Henshaw has starred in over 45 Nollywood movies.[6]

targets.targetText: Ni ọdun 1993, Henshaw ṣe afẹri fun ipo olori ninu fiimu When the Sun Sets o si ṣẹgun ipa naa. Eyi ni iṣafihan akọkọ rẹ ninu fiimu Nollywood pataki kan. [1] Henshaw ti ṣaṣere ni awọn fiimu Nollywood ti o ju marundilogbon lọ. [2]

Ni ọdun 1993, Henshaw ṣe afẹri fun ipo olori ninu fiimu Nigbati Sun Seti o si ṣẹgun ipa naa. Eyi ni iṣafihan akọkọ rẹ ninu fiimu Nollywood pataki kan. [1] Henshaw ti ṣaṣere ni awọn fiimu fiimu Nollywood ti o ju 45 lọ. [2]

items.sourceText: Born Aisha Adamu Augie in Zaria, Kaduna State, Nigeria,[1] Augie-Kuta is the daughter of the late Senator Adamu Baba Augie (politician/broadcaster), and Justice Amina Augie (JSC). Augie-Kuta became interested in photography when her father gave her a camera at a young age.

targets.targetText: A bi Aisha Adamu Augie ni Zaria, Ipinle Kaduna, Nigeria, [1] Augie-Kuta jẹ ọmọbinrin oloogbe Senator Adamu Baba Augie (oloselu / olugbohunsafefe), ati Onidajọ Amina Augie (JSC). Augie-Kuta bere si ni nifẹ si fọtoyiya nigbati baba rẹ fun u ni kamẹra ni ọdọ.

A bi Aisha Adamu Augie ni Zaria, Ipinle Kaduna, Nigeria, [1] Augie-Kuta jẹ ọmọbinrin oloogbe Senator Adamu Baba Augie (oloselu / olugbohunsafefe), ati Onidajọ Amina Augie (JSC). Augie-Kuta nifẹ si fọtoyiya nigbati baba rẹ fun u ni kamẹra ni ọdọ.

items.sourceText: Nnenna Rachael Okonkwo (born 26 May 1987) Popularly Known as Nkoli Nwa Nsukka is a Nigerian film actress. She is best known for the film of the same name.[1]

targets.targetText: Nnenna Rachael Okonkwo (ti a bi ni ọjọ 26 Oṣu Karun ọdun 1987) Gbajumọ ti a mọ bi Nkoli Nwa Nsukka jẹ oṣere fiimu ti Ilu Naijiria . O mọ julọ fun fiimu ti orukọ kanna. [1]
Nnenna Rachael Okonkwo (ti a bi ni ọjọ 26 Oṣu Karun ọdun 1987) ti a mọ si Nkoli Nwa Nsukka jẹ oṣere fiimu ti Ilu Naijiria . O gbajumọ julọ fun fiimu Nkoli Nwa Nsukka.[1]

items.sourceText: She was born in Geneva,[3] to Chief and Mrs F.O Williams. She attended Geneva English School and later Home Science Primary School, Ikoyi, for her early education. She went on to Queen’s College, Yaba, University of Lagos.

targets.targetText: A bi ni Geneva, [1] si Oloye ati Iyaafin FO Williams. O lọ si Ile-ẹkọ Gẹẹsi Geneva ati lẹhinna Ile-ẹkọ Alakọbẹrẹ Home Science, Ikoyi, fun eto-ẹkọ ti o kọkọ. O lọ siwaju si Queen's College, Yaba, University of Lagos .

A bi i ni Geneva, [1] si Oloye ati Iyaafin FO Williams. O lọ si Ile-ẹkọ Gẹẹsi Geneva ati lẹhinna Ile-ẹkọ Alakọbẹrẹ Ile-Ile, Ikoyi, fun eto-ẹkọ ti o kọkọ. O lọ siwaju si College's College, Yaba, University of Lagos .

items.sourceText: Otan is located in the northern area of Osun State, thirty-seven kilometers from Oshogbo. It covers a land mass of 100 km2. Its terrain consists of hills, mountains, dense forest, vegetation and gullies. The climate is tropical with warm temperatures and low humidity.[citation needed]

targets.targetText: Otan wa ni agbegbe ariwa ti Ipinle Osun, ibuso ọgbọn ati meje lati Oshogbo . O bo iwọn ilẹ 100 kan km 2 . Ilẹ rẹ ni awọn oke-nla, igbo nla, eweko ati awọn gull. Afẹfẹ jẹ agbegbe ti ilẹ pẹlu awọn iwọn otutu gbigbona ati ọriniinitutu kekere.

items.sourceText: Organized by the Bouregreg Association under the patronage of King Mohammed VI with the aim of promoting women's cinema and highlighting women in cinema, the festival was created in 2004[5][6][7][8][9][6] and was followed by a second edition in 2006. It has been an annual event since 2009[10] (with the exception of 2020, due to the Covid-19 pandemic).[11][12]

targets.targetText: Ti a ṣeto nipasẹ Ẹgbẹ Bouregreg labẹ ìṣàkóso ti Ọba Mohammed VI pẹlu ero lati ṣe igbega si sinima obinrin ati fifi awọn obinrin han ni sinima, ajọdun naa ni a ṣẹda ni ọdun 2004 [1] [2] [3] [4][5] [6] Ti atẹjade keji wáyé ni ọdun 2006. O ti jẹ iṣẹlẹ ọdọọdun lati ọdun 2009 [7] (ayafi ti 2020, nitori ajakaye-arun Covid-19). [8] [9]

Ti a ṣeto nipasẹ Ẹgbẹ Bouregreg labẹ iṣakoso ti Ọba Mohammed VI pẹlu ero lati ṣe igbega si sinima obinrin ati fifi awọn obinrin han ni sinima, ajọdun naa ni a ṣẹda ni ọdun 2004 [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6] ati atẹle nipa atẹjade keji ni ọdun 2006. O ti jẹ iṣẹlẹ ọdọọdun lati ọdun 2009 [7] (ayafi ti 2020, nitori ajakaye-arun Covid-19). [8] [9]

items.sourceText: After Gbemi Olateru-Olagbegi left radio on the 24th of December, 2021. She was appointed as co-founder and co-executive producer of one of Africa's entertainment startups, TNC Africa. TNC Africa is a digital-focused TV and film production company. it was launched in January 2021 by Olawale Adetula and Daniel Aideyan.[10]

targets.targetText: Lẹhin ti Gbemi Olateru-Olagbegi kuro ni redio ni ọjọ 24th ti Oṣu kejila, ọdun 2021. Wọ́n yàn án gẹ́gẹ́ bí olùdásílẹ̀ àti olùpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ aláṣẹ ti ọ̀kan lára àwọn ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ eré ìnàjú ní Áfíríkà, TNC Africa. TNC Africa jẹ TV ti o ni idojukọ oni-nọmba ati ile-iṣẹ iṣelọpọ fiimu. Osu kini odun 2021 ni Olawale Adetula ati Daniel Aideyan se igbekale re. [1]

Lẹhin ti Gbemi Olateru-Olagbegi kuro ni redio ni ọjọ 24 ti Oṣu kejila, ọdun 2021. Wọ́n yàn án gẹ́gẹ́ bí olùdásílẹ̀ àti olùpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ aláṣẹ ti ọ̀kan lára àwọn ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ eré ìnàjú ní Áfíríkà, TNC Africa. TNC Africa jẹ telifisan ti o ni idojukọ oni-nọmba ati ile-iṣẹ iṣelọpọ fiimu. Osu kini odun 2021 ni Olawale Adetula ati Daniel Aideyan se igbekale re. [1]

items.sourceText: Youssra Karim (born 26 March 1997) is a Moroccan para-athlete who specializes in throwing events. She represented Morocco at the Paralympic Games.

targets.targetText: Youssra Karim (ti a bi 26 Oṣu Kẹta 1997) jẹ elere-ije ara Ilu Morocco kan ti o ṣe amọja ni awọn iṣẹlẹ jiju. O ṣe aṣoju Ilu Morocco ni Awọn ere Paralympic .
Youssra Karim (ti a bi ni ọjọ kerindinlogbon Oṣu Kẹta ọdun 1997) jẹ elere-ije ara Ilu Morocco kan ti o ṣe amọja ni awọn ere idaraya Oni jiju. O ṣe aṣoju Ilu Morocco ni Awọn ere Paralympic .

items.sourceText: In his youth, Cheick Traoré played along his brother Baba in his native Pierrefitte-sur-Seine.[1] He is also a professional footballer.[2]

targets.targetText: Ni igba ewe rẹ, Cheick Traoré gba bọọlu pẹlu arakunrin rẹ Baba ni ilu abinibi rẹ Pierrefitte-sur-Seine . [1] Oun na tun jẹ agbabọọlu alamọdaju. [2]
Ni igba ewe rẹ, Cheick Traoré ṣere pẹlu arakunrin rẹ Baba ni ilu abinibi rẹ Pierrefitte-sur-Seine . [1] O tun jẹ agbabọọlu alamọdaju. [2]

items.sourceText: Born in Johannesburg,[1] Makaringe started his career at Moroka Swallows before joining Maritzburg United.[2] Makaringe signed for Orlando Pirates in the summer of 2019.[3][4]

targets.targetText: Ti a bi ni Johannesburg, Makaringe bẹrẹ iṣẹ rẹ ni Moroka Swallows ṣaaju ki o to darapọ mọ Maritzburg United . [1] Makaringe fowo si iwe adehun fun Orlando Pirates ni igba ooru 2019. [2] [3]
Bi ni Johannesburg, Makaringe bẹrẹ iṣẹ rẹ ni Moroka Swallows ṣaaju ki o darapọ mọ Maritzburg United . [1] Makaringe fowo si fun Orlando Pirates ni igba ooru 2019. [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Dário António Marcelino (born 22 October 1992) is an Angolan cyclist, who currently rides for UCI Continental team BAI–Sicasal–Petro de Luanda.[1]

targets.targetText: Dário António Marcelino (ti a bi 22 Oṣu Kẹwa Ọdun 1992) jẹ ẹlẹṣin ẹlẹṣin Angola kan, ti o gun lọwọlọwọ fun ẹgbẹ UCI Continental BAI–Sicasal–Petro de Luanda . [1]
Dário António Marcelino (ti a bi ni ọjọ kejilelogun Oṣu Kẹwa Ọdun 1992) jẹ ẹlẹṣin orilẹ-ede Angola, ti o gun lọwọlọwọ fun ẹgbẹ UCI Continental BAI–Sicasal–Petro de Luanda . [1]

items.sourceText: In 2019, he also represented Burundi at the 2019 African Games and he finished in 6th place in the men's 10,000 metres event.[4]

targets.targetText: Ni ọdun 2019, o tun ṣe aṣoju Burundi ni Awọn ere Afirika 2019 ati pe o pari ni ipo 6th ninu iṣẹlẹ awọn mita 10,000 ọkunrin. [1]
Ni ọdun 2019, o tun ṣe aṣoju orilẹ-ede Burundi ni Awọn ere Afirika 2019 ati pe o pari ni ipo 6th ninu mita 10,000 ọkunrin. [1]

items.sourceText: Gashaka competed in the marathon for Burundi in their country's first Olympics at the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta, where he finished 90th, with a time of 2:32:55.[1] In 1997, Gashaka won a silver medal at the Athletics at the 1997 Jeux de la Francophonie in the 10,000 metres.[2]

targets.targetText: Gashaka dije ninu idije ere- ije fun orilẹ-ede Burundi ni Olimpiiki akọkọ ti orilẹ-ede wọn ni Olimpiiki Igba ooru 1996 ni Atlanta, nibiti o ti pari 90th, pẹlu akoko 2:32:55. [1] Ni ọdun 1997, Gashaka gba ami-ẹri fadaka kan ni ere idaraya ni 1997 Jeux de la Francophonie ni awọn mita 10,000. [2]

Gashaka dije ninu idije ere- ije fun Burundi ni Olimpiiki akọkọ ti orilẹ-ede wọn ni Olimpiiki Igba ooru 1996 ni Atlanta, nibiti o ti pari 90th, pẹlu akoko 2:32:55. [1] Ni 1997, Gashaka gba ami-ẹri fadaka kan ni Awọn elere idaraya ni 1997 Jeux de la Francophonie ni awọn mita 10,000. [2]

items.sourceText: Paul Kuété (born 20 December 1972) is a Cameroonian long-distance runner. He competed in the men's marathon at the 1992 Summer Olympics.[1]

targets.targetText: Paul Kuété (ti a bi ni Ogun 'jo Oṣu kejila ọdun 1972) jẹ olusare ona gigun ara orilẹ-ede Kamẹru. O dije ninu ere -ije awọn ọkunrin ni Olimpiiki Igba ooru 1992 . [1]
Paul Kuété (ti a bi 20 Oṣu kejila ọdun 1972) jẹ olusare gigun-jinna ara ilu Kamẹrika . O dije ninu ere -ije awọn ọkunrin ni Awọn Olimpiiki Igba ooru 1992 . [1]

items.sourceText: Akono later became coach of the Cameroon women's national volleyball team.[1] He coached the women's team at the 2016 Summer Olympics.[3]

targets.targetText: Akono di olukọni ti ẹgbẹ bọọlu afowogba ti orilẹ-ede Cameroon . [1] O ṣe olukẹkọ ẹgbẹ obinrin ni Olimpiiki Igba ooru 2016 . [2]
Akono nigbamii di olukọni ti ẹgbẹ bọọlu afẹsẹgba ti orilẹ-ede Cameroon . [1] O ṣe ikẹkọ ẹgbẹ awọn obinrin ni Awọn Olimpiiki Igba ooru 2016 . [2]

items.sourceText: He competed at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, in the men's 94 kg.[1] He competed at world championships, most recently at the 2009 World Weightlifting Championships.[2]

targets.targetText: O dije ni Olimpiiki Igba ooru 2016 ni Rio de Janeiro, ni 94 kg ti awọn ọkunrin . [1] O dije ni ere-idije agbaye, laipẹ lọwọlọwọ ni ìdíje fun aṣaju-idije Eruwuwo Agbaye 2009 . [2]
O dije ni Olimpiiki Igba ooru 2016 ni Rio de Janeiro, ni 94 kg ti awọn ọkunrin . [1] O dije ni awọn ere-idije agbaye, laipẹ julọ ni Awọn aṣaju-idije iwuwo Agbaye 2009 . [2]

items.sourceText: He played most minutes and scored most points for the Chad national basketball team at the 2011 FIBA Africa Championship in Antananarivo, Madagascar.[1]

targets.targetText: O ṣe awọn iṣẹju pupọ julọ ati gba awọn aaye pupọ julọ fun ẹgbẹ bọọlu inu agbọn orilẹ-ede Chad ni 2011 FIBA Africa Championship ni Antananarivo, Madagascar. [1]
O gba awọn iṣẹju pupọ julọ ati awọn aaye pupọ julọ fun ẹgbẹ bọọlu inu agbọn orilẹ-ede Chad ni 2011 FIBA Africa Championship ni Antananarivo, Madagascar. [1]

items.sourceText: Hassan represented Chad at the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich in the Light-heavyweight class, in the first round he was drawn against Yugoslavian Mate Parlov, he was stopped in the second round, Mate Parlov went on to win the gold medal.[1]

targets.targetText: Hassan ṣe aṣoju Chad ni 1972 Summer Olympics ni Munich ni Light-heavyweight kilasi, ni ipele akoko ti o doju ko ara orilẹ-ede Yugoslavia Mate Parlov, won da duro ni ipele keji, Mate Parlov si tẹsiwaju lati gba ami-ẹri goolu. [1]

Hassan ṣe aṣoju Chad ni 1972 Summer Olympics ni Munich ni Light-heavyweight kilasi, ni akọkọ yika o ti fa lodi si Yugoslavian Mate Parlov, o ti duro ni ipele keji, Mate Parlov tẹsiwaju lati gba ami-ẹri goolu. [1]

items.sourceText: Lekki Lagoon is a lagoon located in Lagos and Ogun states in Nigeria. The lagoon lies directly to the east of Lagos Lagoon and is connected to it by a channel. It is surrounded by many beaches.

targets.targetText: Lekki Lagoon jẹ adagun omi ti o wa ni ilu Eko ati Ogun ni Nigeria . Adagun naa wa taara si ila-oorun ti Lagoon Eko ati pe o ni asopọ pẹlu ikanni kan. O ti wa ni ti yika nipasẹ ọpọlọpọ awọn etikun.
Lekki Lagoon jẹ adagun omi ti o wa ni ilu Eko ati Ogun ni Nigeria . Adagun naa wa taara si ila-oorun ti Lagoon Eko ati pe o ni asopọ pẹlu ikanni kan. O wa ni iyika nipasẹ ọpọlọpọ awọn etikun.

items.sourceText: Max FM, formerly Radio Continental, is an English Nigerian FM radio station that is based in Lagos. It also has a sister radio station under the same brand in Abuja.

targets.targetText: Max FM, tele Redio Continental, jẹ ile-iṣẹ redio FM Naijiria ti Gẹẹsi ti o wa ni Eko . O tun ni ile-iṣẹ redio arabinrin labẹ aami kanna ni Abuja .
Max FM, tele Redio Continental, jẹ ile-iṣẹ radio FM Naijiria ti Gẹẹsi ti o wa ni ipinle Eko . O tun ni ile-iṣẹ redio arabinrin labẹ aami kanna ni Abuja .

items.sourceText: The Lagos Town Council was a local government body founded in 1917. At inception, it primarily dealt with municipal health and sanitary issues and the implementation of a water tenement rate. In 1950, a new local government law created a mayoral council that was composed of 24 elected councilors, this system lasted until 1953. In 1963, the town council became known as the Lagos City Council.

targets.targetText: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ìlú Èkó jẹ́ ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ tí wọ́n dá sílẹ̀ ní ọdún 1917. Ni ibẹrẹ, o koko ni isoro ṣe pẹlu ilera ilu ati awọn ọran imototo ati imuse ti oṣuwọn isọdọtun omi. Ni ọdun 1950, ofin ijọba ibilẹ tuntun kan ṣẹda igbimọ Mayor kan ti o jẹ awọn igbimọ ti a yan 24, eto yii duro titi di ọdun 1953. Ni ọdun 1963, igbimọ ilu di mimọ si Igbimọ Ilu Ilu Eko.

Ìgbìmọ̀ Ìlú Èkó jẹ́ ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ tí wọ́n dá sílẹ̀ ní ọdún 1917. Ni ibẹrẹ, o ni akọkọ ṣe pẹlu ilera ilu ati awọn ọran imototo ati imuse ti oṣuwọn isọdọtun omi. Ni ọdun 1950, ofin ijọba ibilẹ tuntun kan ṣẹda igbimọ Mayor kan ti o jẹ awọn igbimọ ti a yan 24, eto yii duro titi di ọdun 1953. Ni ọdun 1963, igbimọ ilu di mimọ si Igbimọ Ilu Ilu Eko.

items.sourceText: In October 2015, 45 Boko Haram suspects were arrested after plotting to attack the estate, but later found to be a gas explosion.[5]

targets.targetText: Ni Oṣu Kẹwa Ọdun 2015, awọn afurasi Boko Haram 45 ni wọn mu lẹhin ti wọn gbero lati kolu ile-iṣẹ naa, ṣugbọn nigbamii rii pe o jẹ bugbamu gaasi. [1]
Ni Oṣu Kẹwa Ọdun 2015, awọn afurasi Boko Haram 45 ni wọn mu lẹhin ti wọn gbero lati kolu ile-iṣẹ naa, ṣugbọn won pada rii pe o jẹ bugbamu gaasi. [1]

items.sourceText: Ikotun Market also known as irepodun market is an open-air market located in Ikotun, a metropolitan city in Alimosho local government area of Lagos State.[1] The market which is particularly known for its price-based selling technique has about 8,400 lock-up shops and over 10,000 traders-selling items ranging from foodstuff to clothes, appliances, gadgets and so on, making it one of the biggest markets in Lagos and a major contributor to the growth of the economy of the state.[2]

targets.targetText: Ọja Ikotun ti a tun mọ ni ọja irepodun jẹ ọja ita gbangba ti o wa ni Ikotun, ilu nla ni ijọba ibilẹ Alimosho ni Ipinle Eko . [1] Ọja naa ti a mọ pe o se pataki fun ilana titaja ti o da lori idiyele ni o ni awọn ile itaja titiipa 8,400 ati diẹ sii ju awọn oniṣowo 10,000 ti n ta awọn nkan ti o wa lati ounjẹ si awọn aṣọ, awọn ohun elo, awọn irinṣẹ ati bẹbẹ lọ, ti o jẹ ki o jẹ ọkan ninu awọn ọja nla julọ ni Ilu Eko ati oluranlọwọ pataki si idagbasoke eto-ọrọ aje ti ipinle. [2]

[1] Ọja naa ti a mọ ni pataki fun ilana titaja ti o da lori idiyele ni o ni awọn ile itaja titiipa 8,400 ati diẹ sii ju awọn oniṣowo 10,000 ti n ta awọn nkan ti o wa lati ounjẹ si awọn aṣọ, awọn ohun elo, awọn irinṣẹ ati bẹbẹ lọ, ti o jẹ ki o jẹ ọkan ninu awọn ọja nla julọ ni Ilu Eko ati oluranlọwọ pataki si idagbasoke eto-ọrọ aje ti ipinle. [2]

items.sourceText: The 2018 Festival marked the 10th anniversary of the LIJF which was celebrated in the honour of the late Hugh Masekela, the event was graced by great jazz musicians including Saxophonist like Mike Aremu.[15][16]

targets.targetText: Ayeye odun 2018 lo se ayeye odun mewaa ti Lagos Jazz fest eleyii ti won se pelu ola Oloogbe Hugh Masekela, ayeye naa ni awon olorin jazz nla ti se pelu Saxophonist bii Mike Aremu . [1] [2]
Ayeye odun 2018 lo se ayeye odun mewaa ti LIJF eleyii ti won se pelu ola Oloogbe Hugh Masekela, ayeye naa ni awon olorin jazz nla ti se pelu Saxophonist bii Mike Aremu . [1] [2]

items.sourceText: The project is Public-Private Partnership, where the private organisation manages the facility for two-years and then transfer the facility to the government. On 24 February 2016, the State Attorney General and Commissioner for Justice, Kazeem Adeniji announced that the proposed project will be established to combat crime in the state.[4] The project was commissioned on 27 September 2017.[2]

targets.targetText: Ise agbese na jẹ Ajọṣepọ Aladani-Idani, nibiti ajo aladani ti n ṣakoso ohun elo fun ọdun meji ati lẹhinna gbe ohun elo naa si ijọba. Ni ọjọ 24 Oṣu Keji ọdun 2016, Agbẹjọro Gbogbogbo ti Ipinle ati Komisona fun Idajọ, Kazeem Adeniji kede pe iṣẹ akanṣe naa yoo wa ni idasilẹ lati koju iwa-ipa ni ipinlẹ naa. [1] Iṣẹ naa ni a fi aṣẹ fun ni ọjọ 27 Oṣu Kẹsan 2017. [2]

Ise agbese na jẹ Ajọṣepọ Aladani-Idani, nibiti ajo aladani ti n ṣakoso ohun elo fun ọdun meji ati lẹhinna gbe ohun elo naa si ijọba. Ni ọjọ kerin lelogun Oṣu Keji ọdun 2016, Agbẹjọro Gbogbogbo ti Ipinle ati Komisona fun Idajọ, Kazeem Adeniji kede pe iṣẹ akanṣe naa yoo wa ni idasilẹ lati koju iwa-ipa ni ipinlẹ naa. [1] Iṣẹ naa ni a fi aṣẹ fun ni ọjọ keta din logbon Oṣu Kẹsan 2017. [2]

items.sourceText: The fire and rescue service was upgraded to an agency status during Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu's administration, in pursuance of Mr Sanwo-Olu’s THEMES Agenda. The officers and men of the agency are highly trained, disciplined and professional enough about handling their responsibilities. The agency have modern and functioning appliances at their disposal.[6]

targets.targetText: Iṣẹ ina ati igbala naa ni igbega si ipo ile-ibẹwẹ lasiko ijọba Gomina Babajide Sanwo-Olu, ni atẹle eto Agenda Ọgbẹni Sanwo-Olu. Awọn oṣiṣẹ ati awọn ọkunrin ti ile-ibẹwẹ jẹ ogboju, ibawi ati alamọdaju nipa mimu awọn ojuse wọn mu. Ile-ibẹwẹ naa ni awọn ohun elo igbalode ati awọn ohun elo ti n ṣiṣẹ ni ọwọ wọn. [1]

Awọn oṣiṣẹ ati awọn ọkunrin ti ile-ibẹwẹ jẹ ikẹkọ giga, ibawi ati alamọdaju nipa mimu awọn ojuse wọn mu. Ile-ibẹwẹ naa ni awọn ohun elo igbalode ati awọn ohun elo ti n ṣiṣẹ ni ọwọ wọn. [1]

items.sourceText: Saint George Sports Club (Amharic: ቅዱስ ጊዮርጊስ ስፖርት ክለብ, Kidus Giorgis Sport Club), otherwise known as Kidus Giorgis, is a professional football club based in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. They play in the top division of Ethiopian football, the Ethiopian Premier League. Founded in 1935, the club was the first in Ethiopia and was established as a symbol of Ethiopian nationalism and resistance against the occupying forces of fascist Italy.[1]

targets.targetText: Saint George Sports Club (Amharic : Saint ጊዮርጊስ ስፖርት ክለብ, Kidus Giorgis Sport Club), bibẹkọ ti a mọ si Kidus Giorgis, jẹ agbabọọlu afẹsẹgba ọjọgbọn kan ti o da ni Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. Wọn ṣere ni ipele oke ti bọọlu afẹsẹgba Etiopia, Premier League Ethiopia . Ti a da ni ọdun 1935, ẹgbẹ naa jẹ akọkọ ni Etiopia ati pe o ti fi idi rẹ mulẹ gẹgẹbi aami ti orilẹ-ede Etiopia ati atako lodi si awọn agbara gbigba ti fascist Italy . [1]

Saint George Sports Club ( Amharic : Saint ጊዮርጊስ idaraya Club, Kidus Giorgis Sport Club ) , bibẹkọ ti a mọ si Kidus Giorgis, jẹ agbabọọlu afẹsẹgba ọjọgbọn kan ti o da ni Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. Wọn ṣere ni ipele oke ti bọọlu afẹsẹgba Etiopia, Premier League Ethiopia . Ti a da ni ọdun 1935, ẹgbẹ naa jẹ akọkọ ni Etiopia ati pe o ti fi idi rẹ mulẹ gẹgẹbi aami ti orilẹ-ede Etiopia ati atako lodi si awọn agbara gbigba ti fascist Italy . [1]

items.sourceText: The Lake Chad flooded savanna is a flooded grasslands and savannas ecoregion in Africa. It includes the seasonally- and permanently-flooded grasslands and savannas in the basin of Lake Chad in Central Africa, and covers portions of Cameroon, Chad, Niger, and Nigeria.

targets.targetText: Okun Chad ti o kún fun Savanna jẹ awọn ilẹ koriko ti o kún fun iṣan omi ati ecoregion savannas ni Afirika. Ó ní àwọn ilẹ̀ koríko tí omi kún fún ìgbà gbogbo àti àwọn savannas ní àfonífojì Adágún Chad ní Àárín Gbùngbùn Áfíríkà, ó sì bo àwọn apá kan ní Cameroon, Chad, Niger, àti Nàìjíríà .

Okun Chad ti o kún fun Savanna jẹ́ awon ile koríko tí o kún fun iṣan omi ati ecoregion savannas ní Afirika. Ó ní àwọn ilẹ̀ koríko tí omi kún fún ìgbà gbogbo àti àwọn savannas ní àfonífojì Adágún Chad ní Àárín Gbùngbùn Áfíríkà, ó sì bo àwọn apá kan ní Cameroon, Chad, Niger, àti Nàìjíríà.

items.sourceText: Akure Ofosu is of great importance for the conservation of the chimpanzee population in Nigeria. Research conducted during 2007 found 33 nests at four locations, without direct vision.[3]

targets.targetText: Akure Ofosu ṣe pataki pupọ fun itoju awọn olugbe chimpanzee ni Nigeria. Iwadi ti a ṣe lakoko ọdun 2007 ri awọn itẹ 33 ni awọn ipo mẹrin, laisi iran taara. [1]
Akure Ofosu ṣe pataki pupọ fun itoju awọn olugbe Elegbede ni Nàìjíríà. Iwadi ti a ṣe lakoko ọdun 2007 ri awọn itẹ ẹtalelọgbọn ni awọn ipo mẹrin, laisi iran taara. [1]

items.sourceText: Remi was born in Nigeria,[1] one of four children born to British architect Alan Richards (1925-1989)[2] and Ayo Vaughan (1928-1993), a nurse educator who created the Lagos State School of Nursing. Ayo was from a prominent Lagos family whose patriarch was the 19th-century American artisan Scipio Vaughan.[3] The family members all used the hyphenated surname Vaughan-Richards.[4] Her maternal great-grandfather is the Lagos aristocrat Taiwo Olowo.[5][6]

targets.targetText: A bi Remi ni Naijiria, [1] ọkan ninu awọn ọmọ mẹrin ti a bi si Alan Richards ayaworan ile Gẹẹsi (1925-1989) [2] ati Ayo Vaughan (1928-1993), olukọni nọọsi ti o ṣẹda Ile-iwe Nọọsi ti Ipinle Eko. Ayo jẹ lati idile Eko olokiki kan ti baba-nla rẹ jẹ alamọdaju Amẹrika ti ọrundun 19th Scipio Vaughan . [3] Gbogbo awọn ọmọ ẹbi naa lo orukọ-idile ti a sọ di Vaughan-Richards. [4] Baba baba rẹ iya jẹ aristocrat Lagos Taiwo Olowo . [5] [6]

A bi Remi ní Naijiria,[1] ọkan ninu awọn ọmọ mẹrin ti a bi si Alan Richards ayaworan ile Gẹẹsi (1925 -1989) [2] ati Ayo Vaughan (1928-1993), olukọni nọọsi ti o ṣẹda Ile-iwe Nọọsi ti Ipinle Eko. Ayo jẹ lati idile Eko olokiki kan ti baba-nla rẹ jẹ alamọdaju Amẹrika ti ọrundun 19th Scipio Vaughan.[3] Gbogbo awọn ọmọ ẹbi naa lo orukọ-idile ti a sọ di Vaughan-Richards.[4] Baba baba rẹ iya jẹ aristocrat Lagos Taiwo Olowo.[5][6]

items.sourceText: Ejike Asiegbu // ⓘ is a Nigerian film actor and film director who once served as President of the Actors Guild of Nigeria.[1][2] He was also previously appointed as personal assistant to former Biafran leader Odumegwu Ojukwu during the 1994 National Constitutional Conference in Abuja.[3]

targets.targetText: Ejike Asiegbu // ⓘ</link> jè oṣere fiimu ati oludari fiimu ti orilẹ-ede Naijiria ti o jẹ Alakoso Ẹgbẹ Awọn oṣere ti Nigeria nigbakan rí.[1][2] O tun ti yan tẹlẹ gẹgẹbi oluranlọwọ ara ẹni fun Odumegwu Ojukwu ti o jẹ oluranlọwọ fun Biafra tẹlẹ lakoko Apejọ T’olofin ti Orilẹ-ede 1994 ni Abuja .[3]

Ejike Asiegbu // ⓘ</link> jẹ oṣere fiimu ati oludari fiimu ti orilẹ-ede Naijiria ti o jẹ Alakoso Ẹgbẹ Awọn oṣere ti Nigeria nigbakan ri. [1] [2] O tun ti yan tẹlẹ gẹgẹbi oluranlọwọ ara ẹni fun Odumegwu Ojukwu ti o jẹ oluranlọwọ fun Biafra tẹlẹ lakoko Apejọ T’olofin ti Orilẹ-ede 1994 ni Abuja . [3]

items.sourceText: In January, 1978, Bankole took at job at City Securities Limited (stockbrokers), in Lagos. He trained as Dealer on the floor of the Nigeria Stock Exchange. He moved on to M. L. Securities Limited (stockbrokers); dealt on the floor of the Nigerian Stock Exchange.

targets.targetText: Ni January, 1978, Bankole gba iṣẹ ni City Securities Limited (stockbrokers), ni Lagos. O ṣe ikẹkọ bi Oluṣowo lori ilẹ ti Iṣowo Iṣowo Naijiria. O gbe siwaju si M. L. Securities Limited (stockbrokers); ti a ṣe lori ilẹ ti Iṣowo Iṣowo Naijiria.

Ni January, 1978, Bankole gba iṣẹ ni City Securities Limited (stockbrokers), ni Lagos . O ṣe ikẹkọ bi Oluṣowo lori ilẹ ti Iṣowo Iṣowo Naijiria . O gbe lọ si ML Securities Limited (stockbrokers); ti a ṣe lori ilẹ ti Iṣowo Iṣowo Naijiria.

items.sourceText: Kabiru Aderemi Adeyemo (born1965 )he is a Nigeria Professor of Management & Accounting at Lead City University Ibadan. Oyo State, Nigeria.[1] He is the Vice chancellor of Lead City University.[2]

targets.targetText: Kabiru Aderemi Adeyemo (ti a bi ni 1965) o jẹ Ọjọgbọn ti Management & Accounting ni Ilu Naijiria ni Ile-ẹkọ giga Lead City Ibadan. Ipinle Oyo, Nigeria. O jẹ Igbakeji Alakoso ti Ile-ẹkọ giga Ilu Lead.

Kabiru Aderemi Adeyemo (ti a bi ni 1965) o jẹ Ọjọgbọn ti Management & Accounting ni Ile-ẹkọ giga Lead City Ilu Ibadan . Ipinle Oyo, Nigeria . [1] O jẹ Igbakeji Alakoso ti Ile-ẹkọ giga Ilu Asiwaju . [2]

items.sourceText: Tsega died on 1 January 2018 in Hamilton, Canada.[1][21] Tsega was described by the Ethiopian Observer as "a light in the darkness" that will be always remembered.[3]

targets.targetText: Tsega ku ni ọjọ 1 Oṣu Kini ọdun 2018 ni Hamilton, Canada.[1][21] Oluwo Ilu Etiopia ṣe apejuwe Tsega gẹgẹbi “imọlẹ ninu okunkun” ti yoo jẹ iranti nigbagbogbo.[12]
Tsega ku ni ọjọ 1 Oṣu Kini ọdun 2018 ni Hamilton, Canada. [1] [2] Oluwo Ilu Etiopia ṣe apejuwe Tsega gẹgẹbi “imọlẹ ninu okunkun” ti yoo jẹ iranti nigbagbogbo. [3]

items.sourceText: Obasi returned to Nigeria to become a senior meteorologist in charge of research and training at the Nigerian Meteorological Department from 1963 to 1967, and he was also a senior meteorologist in charge of technical administration at the department's headquarters in Lagos from 1966 to 1967. Additionally, he served as the senior meteorologist in charge of meteorological services at Lagos Airport, Ikeja from 1964 to 1965, and as chairman of the working group on tropical meteorology for the World Meteorological Organization from 1965 to 1967.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Obasi pada si orile-ede Naijiria lati di oga agba oju ojo to n dari iwadi ati idanileko ni ile ise nipa oju ojo ni Naijiria lati odun 1963 si 1967, o si tun je oga agba oju ojo to n dari isejoba tekinoloji ni olu ile eka naa ni ilu Eko lati odun 1966 si 1967. Ni afikun, o ṣiṣẹ bi oga oju ojo ti o nṣe abojuto awọn iṣẹ oju ojo ni Papa ọkọ ofurufu ilu Eko, ni Ikeja lati ọdun 1964 si 1965, ati bi alaga ẹgbẹ ti n ṣiṣẹ lori oju ojo otutu fun Ajo Oju-ojo Agbaye lati 1965 si 1967. [1] [2]

Obasi pada si orile-ede Naijiria lati di oga agba oju ojo to n dari iwadi ati idanileko ni ile ise nipa oju ojo ni Naijiria lati odun 1963 si 1967, o si tun je oga agba oju ojo to n dari isejoba tekinoloji ni olu ile eka naa ni ilu Eko lati odun 1966 si 1967. Ni afikun, o ṣiṣẹ bi oga meteorologist ti o nṣe abojuto awọn iṣẹ oju ojo ni Papa ọkọ ofurufu Lagos, Ikeja lati ọdun 1964 si 1965, ati bi alaga ẹgbẹ ti n ṣiṣẹ lori meteorology otutu fun Ajo Oju-ojo Agbaye lati 1965 si 1967. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: She is the group managing director of The Rose of Sharon Group and the executive vice chairman of Famfa Oil Limited.[3]

targets.targetText: O jẹ oludari ẹgbẹ ti Rose ti Sharon Group ati igbakeji alaga ti Famfa Oil Limited . [1]
O jẹ oludari oludari ẹgbẹ ti The Rose ti Sharon Group ati igbakeji alaṣẹ ti Famfa Oil Limited.

items.sourceText: He was born to the family of Mr and Mrs Popoola Of Obatiwajoye compound in Offa on 17 January 1971. He earned his bachelor's degree from Obafemi Awolowo University in Political Science and attended Delar College of Education, IdoOsi, Ekiti State For his National Certificate of Education[1]

targets.targetText: A bi si idile Ogbeni ati Iyaafin Popoola Of Obatiwajoye compound ni Offa ni ojo 17 osu kini odun 1971. O ti gba oye oye lati ile iwe giga Obafemi Awolowo ni imo oselu, o si lo si Delar College of Education, IdoOsi, Ekiti State Fun Certificate of Education National re [1]

A bi si idile Ogbeni ati Iyaafin Popoola ti agbo-ile Obatiwajoye ni Offa ni ojo 17 osu kini odun 1971. O kàwé gba oye lati ile iwe giga Obafemi Awolowo ni imo oselu, o si lo si Delar College of Education, IdoOsi, Ekiti State Fun Certificate of Education National re [1][2]

items.sourceText: Jimoh Buraimoh is also an efficient teaching artist. In 1974, he taught at the Haystack Mountain School of Crafts in Maine. He also taught at the University of Bloomington and other schools in New York, Boston and Los Angeles.

targets.targetText: Jimoh Buraimoh tun jẹ olorin ikọni daradara. Ni ọdun 1974, o kọ ẹ̀kọ́ ní Ile-iwe Haystack Mountain ti Àwọn iṣẹ ọnà ni Maine . Ó tún kọ ni University of Bloomington àti àwọn ilé-ìwé mìíràn ni New York, Boston àti Los Angeles.

Jimoh Buraimoh tun jẹ olorin ikọni daradara. Ni ọdun 1974, o kọ ẹkọ ni Ile-iwe Haystack Mountain ti Awọn iṣẹ ọnà ni Maine . O tun kọ ni University of Bloomington ati awọn ile-iwe miiran ni New York, Boston ati Los Angeles.

items.sourceText: Offa is a village in southern Ivory Coast. It is in the sub-prefecture of Agboville, Agboville Department, Agnéby-Tiassa Region, Lagunes District.

targets.targetText: Offa jẹ abule kan ni gusu Ivory Coast . O wa ni agbegbe agbegbe ti Agboville, Ẹka Agboville, Agbegbe Agnéby-Tiassa, Agbegbe Lagunes .
Offa jẹ abule kan ni gusu Ivory Coast . O wa ni agbegbe agbegbe ti Agboville, Ẹka Agboville, Agbegbe Agnéby-Tiassa, ni Agbegbe Lagunes .[1]

items.sourceText: Jiani returned to Canada to again work with Joe La Greca on her 1996 album, Superstar. It produced two singles, "Come and Get Your Love" and "Superstar".

targets.targetText: Jiani padà sí Canada láti tún ṣiṣẹ́ pẹlú Joe La Greca lórí àwo-orin 1996 rè, Superstar . Ó ṣe àwọn akọrin méjì, “ Come And Get Your Love ” àti “Superstar”.
Jiani pada si Canada lati tun ṣiṣẹ pẹlu Joe La Greca lori awo-orin 1996 rẹ, Superstar . O ṣe awọn akọrin meji, “ Wá Gba Ifẹ Rẹ ” ati “Superstar”.

items.sourceText: Musa became the first Nigerian to score more than once in a FIFA World Cup match, after scoring twice against Argentina in the 2014 FIFA World Cup.[4] Musa is also the first Nigerian to score in two FIFA World Cup competitions, after scoring another brace against Iceland in the group stage of the 2018 FIFA World Cup.[5] With 108 appearances, he is Nigeria's most capped player since November 2021. Musa was a member of the Saudi club Al Nassr's squad that won the Saudi Premier League and Saudi Super Cup, both in 2019.[6]

targets.targetText: Musa jẹ́ ọmọ Nàìjíríà àkọ́kọ́ tí ó gbá ami ayo diẹ sii ju ẹ̀ẹ̀kan lọ ní ìdíje FIFA World Cup, lẹhin ti o gba wọle lẹẹmeji si Argentina ni 2014 FIFA World Cup . [1] Musa tun jẹ ọmọ orilẹ-ede Naijiria akọkọ ti o gba wọle ni awọn idije FIFA World Cup meji, lẹhin ti o gba ami ayo miiran si Iceland ni ipele ẹgbẹ ti 2018 FIFA World Cup . [2] Pẹ̀lú àwọn ìfarahàn 108, ó jẹ́ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Nàìjíríà julọ lati Oṣu kọkanla ọdun 2021. Musa jẹ ọmọ ẹgbẹ agbabọọlu Saudi club Al Nassr ti o gba Premier League Saudi ati Super Cup, mejeeji ni ọdun 2019. [3]

Musa di ọmọ Naijiria akọkọ ti o gba ami ayo diẹ sii ju ẹẹkan lọ ni idije FIFA World Cup, lẹhin ti o gba wọle lẹẹmeji si Argentina ni 2014 FIFA World Cup . [1] Musa tun jẹ ọmọ orilẹ-ede Naijiria akọkọ ti o gba wọle ni awọn idije FIFA World Cup meji, lẹhin ti o gba ami ayo miiran si Iceland ni ipele ẹgbẹ ti 2018 FIFA World Cup . [2] Pẹlu awọn ifarahan 108, o jẹ agbabọọlu Naijiria julọ lati Oṣu kọkanla ọdun 2021. Musa jẹ ọmọ ẹgbẹ agbabọọlu Saudi club Al Nassr ti o gba Premier League Saudi ati Super Cup, mejeeji ni ọdun 2019. [3]

items.sourceText: Owolabi Olatunde Rasaq is a Nigerian town planner and politician representing the Share/Oke-Ode constituency, Ifelodun local government area in the 9th and 10th Assembly of the Kwara State House of Assembly.[1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Owolabi Olatunde Rasaq je ọmọ Naijiria ati oloselu to n soju agbegbe Share/Oke-Ode, ijoba ibile Ifelodun ni Ile igbimo asofin kẹsàn-án ati Kẹ̀wá ni ile aṣofin Ipinle Kwara . [1] [2] [3]
Owolabi Olatunde Rasaq je oluso ilu Naijiria ati oloselu to n soju agbegbe Share/Oke-Ode, ijoba ibile Ifelodun ni Ile igbimo asofin 9th ati 10th ti Ile-igbimọ aṣofin Ipinle Kwara . [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Chigozie Nwaneri (born on 24 February 1977) is a Nigerian politician and lawmaker, currently serving as the Chief Whip, representing Oru East constituency in the Imo State House of Assembly.[1]

targets.targetText: Chigozie Nwaneri (ti a bi ni 24 Kínní 1977) jẹ oloselu ati aṣofin orilẹ-ede Naijiria kan, ti n ṣiṣẹ lọwọlọwọ bi Oloye Whip, ti o nsoju agbegbe Oru East ni Ile-igbimọ Aṣofin Ipinle Imo . [1]
Chigozie Nwaneri (ti a bi ni 24 Kínní 1977) jẹ olóṣèlú ati aṣofin orilẹ-ede Nàìjíríà kan, ti n ṣiṣẹ lọwọlọwọ bi agbófinró ti o nsoju agbegbe Oru East ni Ile-igbimọ Aṣofin Ipinle Imo . [1]

items.sourceText: In 2022 he moved to Labor Party and won the nomination for the Anambra Senatorial Elections. He won the seat and began serving as Senator in June 2023.[8]

targets.targetText: Ni ọdun 2022 o gbe lọ si Labour Party o si bori yiyan fun idibo Senatorial Anambra. O bori ijoko naa o bẹrẹ si ṣiṣẹ gẹgẹbi Alagba ni Oṣu Karun ọdun 2023. [1]
Ni ọdun 2022 o gbe lọ si Labour Party o si bori yiyan fun ìdìbò Senatorial Anambra. O bori ijoko naa o bẹrẹ si ṣiṣẹ gẹgẹbi Alàgbà ni Oṣu Kàrún ọdun 2023. [1]

items.sourceText: Umar Saidu Doka is a Nigerian politician. He served as member representing Shiroro/Rafi/Munya Federal Constituency in the House of Representatives.[1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Umar Saidu Doka je oloselu omo Naijiria . O ṣiṣẹ bi ọmọ ẹgbẹ ti o nsoju Shiroro/Rafi/Munya Federal Constituency ni Ile Awọn Aṣoju . [1] [2] [3]
Umar Saidu Doka je oloselu omo Naijiria . O ṣiṣẹ bi ọmọ ẹgbẹ ti o nsójú Shiroro/Rafi/Munya ni ile ìgbìmò aṣòfin àgbà . [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Yusuf Abdulwaheed Gbenga is a Nigerian mechanical engineer and politician representing the Essa/Shawo Igboidun constituency, Offa local government area in the 9th and 10th kwara State House of Assembly.[1][2]

targets.targetText: Yusuf Abdulwaheed Gbenga je onimọ-ẹrọ ati oloselu ọmọ orilẹede Naijiria to n ṣoju ẹkun idibo Essa/Shawo Igboidun, ni ijọba ibilẹ Offa ni ilé ìgbìmò aṣòfin kẹsàn-án ni ipinlẹ Kwara [1] [2]
Yusuf Abdulwaheed Gbenga je onimọ-ẹrọ ati oloselu ọmọ orilẹede Naijiria to n ṣoju ẹkun idibo Essa/Shawo Igboidun, ni ijọba ibilẹ Offa ni ile igbimọ aṣofin ipinlẹ 9th ati 10th kwara . [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Yusuf, is a certified mechanical engineer, transitioned into politics after serving under the Kwara State Ministry of Works and the Kwara State House of Assembly from 2010 to 2018. He contested and won the ticket to represent Essa/Shawo/Igboidun constituency in the Kwara State House of Assembly under the All Progressive Congress in 2019 and won his re-election bid during the 2023 general election..[1]

targets.targetText: Yusuf, jẹ ẹlẹrọ ẹrọ ti o ni ifọwọsi, o yipada si iṣelu lẹhin ti o ṣiṣẹ labẹ Ile-iṣẹ Iṣẹ ti Ipinle Kwara ati ilẹ ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ìpínlè Kwara lalàti ọdún 2010 si 2018. O dije, o si gba tikeeti lati ṣojú àgbègbè Essa/Shawo/Igboidun ni ile ìgbìmò asofin ìpínlè Kwara labe egbe oselu All Progressive Congress lodun 2019 o si jawe olubori ibo atundi ibo lódun 2023.. [1]

Yusuf, jẹ ẹlẹrọ ẹrọ ti o ni ifọwọsi, o yipada si iṣelu lẹhin ti o ṣiṣẹ labẹ Ile-iṣẹ Iṣẹ ti Ipinle Kwara ati Ile-igbimọ Ile-igbimọ Ipinle Kwara lati ọdun 2010 si 2018. O dije, o si gba tikeeti lati soju agbegbe Essa/Shawo/Igboidun ni ile igbimo asofin ipinle Kwara labe egbe oselu All Progressive Congress lodun 2019 o si jawe olubori ibo atundi ibo lodun 2023.. [1]

Gẹgẹbi Gomina ti Ipinle Imo, Ohundioha jẹ ẹtọ fun ipilẹṣẹ awọn eto imulo pataki ti o mu ojuse inawo pọ si ni Ipinle naa. Iwọnyi pẹlu:

items.sourceText: Ahmed Ogembe is a Nigerian politician. He served as the Senator for Kogi Central Senatorial District in the 8th National Assembly. He was also a former chairman of Okene Local Government Area in Kogi State.[1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Ahmed Ogembe je olóṣèlú ọmọ orílè-èdè Nàìjíríà. O ṣiṣẹ gẹgẹbi Senato fun Kogi Central Senatorial District ni Apejọ orilẹ-ede kejo. O tun jẹ alága tẹlẹ fun ijọba ibilẹ Okene ni ipinlẹ Kogi . [1] [2] [3]
Ahmed Ogembe je oloselu omo Naijiria. O ṣiṣẹ gẹgẹbi Alagba fun Kogi Central Senatorial District ni Apejọ orilẹ-ede 8th. O tun jẹ alaga tẹlẹ fun ijọba ibilẹ Okene ni ipinlẹ Kogi . [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Olusola Steve Fatoba was born on 10 October 1967 and hails from Ekiti State. In 2019, he succeeded Sunday Oladimeji and was elected into the Federal House of Assembly. He was re-elected in 2023 for a second term under the All Progressive Congress (APC). He formerly served as Supervisory Councilor for Works, Ado Local Government, Ekiti.[1][3]

targets.targetText: Ojo kewaa osu kewaa odun 1967 ni won bi Olusola Steve Fatoba, o si wa lati ipinle Ekiti . Ni ọdun 2019, o ṣe aṣeyọri Sunday Oladimeji ati pe wọn dibo si Ile-igbimọ Aṣofin apapọ. O tun dibo yan ni 2023 fun saa keji labẹ All Progressive Congress (APC). Ó sìn nígbà kan rí gẹ́gẹ́ bí Alámójútó Ìgbìmọ̀ Iṣẹ́, Ìjọba Ìbílẹ̀ Ado, Èkìtì. [1] [2]

Ojo kewaa osu kẹwàá ọdún 1967 ni won bi Olusola Steve Fatoba, o si wa lati Ìpínlẹ̀ Ekiti . Ni ọdun 2019, o ṣe aṣeyọri Sunday Oladimeji ati pe wọn dibo si Ile-igbimọ Aṣofin apapọ. O tun dibo yan ni 2023 fun saa keji labẹ ẹgbẹ òṣèlú All Progressive Congress (APC). Ó sìn nígbà kan rí gẹ́gẹ́ bí Alámójútó Ìgbìmọ̀ Iṣẹ́, Ìjọba Ìbílẹ̀ Ado, Èkìtì. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Monday Onyeme was appointed Chairman of the Delta State Board of Internal Revenue in 2015,[10] and was reappointed in 2019 for another term.[11] On 23 June 2022, He was announced the deputy governorship candidate and running mate to the governorship candidate, Sheriff Oborevwori.[12][13]

targets.targetText: Monday Onyeme ni a yàn ni Alaga ti Delta State Board of Internal Revenue ni 2015, [1] ati pe a tun yan ni 2019 fun igba miiran. [2] Ni ọjọ 23 Oṣu Kẹfa ọdun 2022, o ti kede oludije igbakeji gomina ati ẹlẹgbẹ oludije fun oludije gomina, Sheriff Oborevwori . [3] [4]

Monday Onyeme ni a yàn ni Alága ti Delta State Board of Internal Revenue ni ọdún 2015, [1] ati pe a tun yàn ni 2019 fun ìgbà mìíràn. [2] Ni ọjọ 23 Oṣu Kẹfa ọdun 2022, o ti kéde oludije igbá-kejì gómìnà fún oludije fun ipò gómìnà, Sheriff Oborevwori . [3] [4]

items.sourceText: After his education, Eze worked as a communications specialist with the World Bank project for HIV/AIDS and United Nations Population Fund before becoming a full-time pastor.[1][2][3] He married Eno Ebele Jerry on 17 March 2007. The couple has two children; a girl, Samara; and a boy, Jerry.[4]

targets.targetText: Lẹhin eto-ẹkọ rẹ, Eze ṣiṣẹ gẹgẹbi alamọja ibaraẹnisọrọ pẹlu ile iṣẹ Banki Agbaye fun HIV/AIDS ati Fund Population United Nations ṣaaju ki o to di oluso-aguntan ni kikun. [1] [2] [3] Ó fẹ́ Eno Ebele Jerry ní ọjọ́ kẹtàdínlógún oṣù kẹta ọdún 2007. Tọkọtaya naa ni ọmọ meji; ọmọbinrin kan to je Samara; ati ọmọkunrin kan to je Jerry. [4]

Lẹhin eto-ẹkọ rẹ, Eze ṣiṣẹ gẹgẹbi alamọja ibaraẹnisọrọ pẹlu iṣẹ Banki Agbaye fun HIV/AIDS ati Fund Population United Nations ṣaaju ki o to di oluso-aguntan ni kikun. [1] [2] [3] Ó fẹ́ Eno Ebele Jerry ní ọjọ́ kẹtàdínlógún oṣù kẹta ọdún 2007. Tọkọtaya naa ni ọmọ meji; ọmọbinrin kan, Samara; ati ọmọkunrin kan, Jerry. [4]

items.sourceText: Martins Vincent Otse was born on 8 April 1994 in Kaduna, Nigeria.[5] Although born in Kaduna, he is originally from Edo State. Otse spent his formative years in Kaduna.[6]

targets.targetText: Martins Vincent Otse ni a bi ni ọjọ 8 Oṣu Kẹrin ọdun 1994 ni Kaduna, Nigeria . [1] Bo tile je pe ilu Kaduna ni won bi i, o je omo ipinle Edo . Otse lo ọdun igbekalẹ rẹ ni Kaduna. [2]
Martins Vincent Otse ni a bi ni ọjọ kejo, Oṣu Kẹrin ọdun 1994 ni Ipinlẹ Kaduna, Nigeria.[1] Bo tile je pe ilu Kaduna ni won bi i, o jẹ ọmọ bibi ipinle Edo. Otse lo ọdun igbekalẹ rẹ ni Kaduna.[2]

items.sourceText: Senator Tejuoso is married to Olori Moji Tejuoso (née Okoya).[18] The Olori is one of the daughters of the renowned Nigerian businessman, Chief Razaq Okoya. She is a philanthropist and socialite. They are blessed with children and grandchildren.[19]

targets.targetText: Tejuoso ti ni iyawo si Olori Moji Tejuoso (née Okoya). [1] Olori jẹ ọkan ninu awọn ọmọbirin ti oniṣowo olokiki Naijiria, Oloye Razaq Okoya . O jẹ olutọju ati igbimọ awujo. Wọn ti ni ibukun pẹlu awọn ọmọde ati awọn ọmọ ọmọ. [2]

Igbimọ Tejuoso ti ni iyawo si Olori Moji Tejuoso (née Okoya). [1] Olori jẹ ọkan ninu awọn ọmọbirin ti oniṣowo olokiki Naijiria, Oloye Razaq Okoya . O jẹ olutọju ati igbimọ awujo. Wọn ti ni ibukun pẹlu awọn ọmọde ati awọn ọmọ ọmọ. [2]

items.sourceText: Mz Kiss was born 1992 in Okitipupa, a town in local government area of Ondo State,[1][8] Western Nigeria, she attended Kembus Nursery and Primary schools, Abeokuta Grammar School, Ogun state before attending the National Open University of Nigeria where she studied Mass Communication.

items.sourceText: Segun Agbaje attended St Gregory’s College, Obalende, Lagos State, Nigeria, and St Augustine Academy, Kent, England, for his secondary education. He then proceeded to University of San Francisco, California, where he earned Bachelor of Accounting and Master of Business Administration degrees.

Segun Agbaje lọ si awon ile iwe St Gregory's College, Obalende, Ipinle Eko, Nigeria, ati St Augustine Academy, Kent, England, fun eto-ẹkọ giga rẹ. Lẹhinna o tẹsiwaju si University of San Francisco California, nibi ti o ti gba Aakẹkọ ti Iṣiro ati Titunto si ti Awọn oye Isakoso Iṣowo.

items.sourceText: In 2010, Tunde was the recipient of the African Leadership Award. He was also awarded an honorary doctorate in business administration from Crescent University in Abeokuta, Nigeria.[4] Tunde serves as a Goodwill Ambassador, Honorary Citizen of the city of Houston and Honorary Consul of Barbados.

targets.targetText: Ni ọdun 2010, Tunde ni olugba Aami Eye Olori ile Afirika. O si tun gba oye ninu iṣakoso iṣowo lati Ile-ẹkọ giga Crescent ni Abeokuta, Nigeria. [1]Tunde ṣe iranṣẹ bi Ambassador Iwurere, Ilu ọlaju ti ilu ti Houston ati Ọla Consul ti Barbados .

Ni ọdun 2010, Tunde ni olugba Aami Eye Olori ile Afirika. O tun fun un ni oye oye oye ninu iṣakoso iṣowo lati Ile-ẹkọ giga Crescent ni Abeokuta, Nigeria. [1] Tunde ṣe iranṣẹ bi Ambassador Iwurere, Ilu ọlaju ti ilu ti Houston ati Ọla Consul ti Barbados .

items.sourceText: In April 2021, he surpassed Gianluca Vacchi as the most-followed Italian TikToker, and, in July 2021, he surpassed Addison Rae to become the second most-followed TikToker.[5][6] In August 2021, Lame appeared as a co-star for Juventus F.C.'s announcement of Manuel Locatelli.[7][8]

targets.targetText: Ni Oṣu Kẹrin ọdun 2021, o kọja Gianluca Vacchi bi TikToker ti Ilu Italia ti o tẹle julọ, ati pe, ni Oṣu Keje ọdun 2021, o kọja Addison Rae lati di TikToker ti o tẹle julọ keji.[1][2] Ni Oṣu Kẹjọ ọdun 2021, Lame farahan bi irawọ ẹlẹgbẹ kan fun ikede Juventus FC ti Manuel Locatelli.[3][4]

items.sourceText: Naima El-Rhouati (born 19 July 1976) is a Moroccan gymnast. She competed in five events at the 1996 Summer Olympics.[1]

targets.targetText: Naima El-Rhouati (ti a bi ni ọjọ kankandinlogun osu Keje odun 1976) je elere idaraya ara ilu Moroccan . O dije ni awọn iṣẹlẹ marun ni Olimpiiki Igba ooru 1996 . [1]
Naima El-Rhouati (ojoibi 19 Keje 1976) je elere idaraya ara ilu Moroccan . O dije ni awọn iṣẹlẹ marun ni Awọn Olimpiiki Igba ooru 1996 . [1]

items.sourceText: In 1981, she became a Graduate Assistant in the FaU.NN. of Pharmaceutical Sciences, U.N.N. In 1990, she became a Senior Lecturer and in 1996, she was made a Consultant Pharmacologist at the College of Medicine.[1]

targets.targetText: Ni ọdun 1981, o di Oluranlọwọ Onkawegboye ni FaUNN. ti imo sáyẹnsì Egbogi, UNN Ni ọdun 1990, o di Olukọni Agba ati ni ọdun 1996, o jẹ Onimọran elegbogi ni Ile eko Oogun. [1]

items.sourceText: Cheick Omar Traoré (born 31 March 1995) is a professional footballer who plays as a right-back for Ligue 2 club Dijon. Born in France, he plays for the Mali national team.

targets.targetText: Cheick Omar Traoré (ti a bi 31 Oṣu Kẹta 1995) jẹ agbabọọlu alamọdaju ti o ṣere bi ẹhin -ọtun fun ẹgbẹ Ligue 2 Dijon . Ti a bi ni Faranse, o ṣere fun ẹgbẹ orilẹ-ede Mali .
Cheick Omar Traoré (ti a bi ni ọjọ kankanlelogbon oṣu Kẹta ọdun 1995) jẹ agbabọọlu alamọdaju ti o ngba ibi apa ẹhin -ọtun fun ẹgbẹ Ligue 2 Dijon . Ti a bi ni Faranse, o ṣere fun ẹgbẹ orilẹ-ede Mali .

items.sourceText: He was first called up to the senior national team for 2016 African Nations Championship qualification, where he played both legs against the Ivory Coast. He was later called up by head coach Avram Grant for the 2017 Africa Cup of Nations.[12] He is the second deputy captain of the Ghana national football team.[13][14]

targets.targetText: O koko pe e si egbe agba agba fun idije ifesewonse asiwaju orile-ede Afirika 2016, nibi ti o ti gba ese mejeji si Ivory Coast . Lẹhinna o pe nipasẹ olukọni agba Avram Grant fun 2017 Africa Cup of Nations . [1] Oun ni igbakeji olori ẹgbẹ agbabọọlu orilẹede Ghana . [2] [3]

A koko pe e si egbe agba fun idije ifesewonse asiwaju orile-ede Afirika 2016, nibi ti o ti gba ifẹsẹwọnsẹ mejeeji pẹlu Ivory Coast . Lẹhinna olukọni agba Avram Grant pe fun 2017 Africa Cup of Nations . [1] Oun ni igbakeji olori ẹgbẹ agbabọọlu orilẹede Ghana . [2] [3]

items.sourceText: Hamadou Evelé (born 15 October 1949) is a Cameroonian athlete. He competed in the men's high jump at the 1972 Summer Olympics.[1]

targets.targetText: Hamadou Evelé (ti a bi ni ọjọ karundinlogun Oṣu Kẹwa Ọdun 1949) jẹ elere idaraya ara Kamẹru . O dije ninu ifo giga ti ọkunrin ni Awọn Olimpiiki Igba ooru 1972 . [1]

items.sourceText: Lateef Olalekan Kayode (born March 3, 1983) is a Nigerian professional boxer who challenged for the WBA cruiserweight title in 2015.

targets.targetText: Lateef Olalekan Kayode (ti a bi ni ọjọ keta oṣu keta, ọdun 1983) jẹ ojogbon afẹṣẹja ọmọ orilẹede Naijiria ti o dije fun akọle cruiserweight WBA ni ọdun 2015.
Lateef Olalekan Kayode (ti a bi ni March 3, 1983) jẹ afẹṣẹja ọjọgbọn ọmọ orilẹede Naijiria ti o koju fun akọle cruiserweight WBA ni ọdun 2015.

items.sourceText: Sarah Adegoke (born 1997) is a Nigerian tennis player. She is currently the highest ranked tennis player in the women's single category according to Nigeria Tennis Federation.[1]

targets.targetText: Sarah Adegoke (ojoibi 1997) je elere tennis omo Naijiria. Lọwọlọwọ o jẹ agbabọọlu tẹnisi ti o ga julọ ni isọri ẹyọkan ti awọn obinrin gẹgẹ bi Federation Tennis Nigeria. [1]
Sarah Adegoke (ojoibi 1997) je elere tenisi omo orilẹ-ede Naijiria. Lọwọlọwọ oun lo jẹ agbabọọlu tẹnisi ti o ga julọ ni isọri ẹyọkan ti awọn obinrin gẹgẹ bi Federation Tennis Nigeria. [1]

items.sourceText: In August 2018, she was ranked first and third in the singles and doubles category according to the Nigeria Tennis Federation.[1]

targets.targetText: Ni Oṣu Kẹjọ ọdun 2018, o wa ni ipo akọkọ ati kẹta ninu ẹka ẹyọkan ati ilọpo meji ni ibamu si Federation Tennis Nigeria. [1]
Ni Oṣu Kẹjọ ọdun 2018, o de ipo akọkọ ati ikẹta ninu ẹka ẹyọkan ati ti eeyanmeji ni ibamu si Fedirasan Tenisi Nigeria. [1]

items.sourceText: American International School of Lagos (AISL) is an American international school in Lagos, Nigeria serving preschool to grade 12. The Victoria Island campus, located on 6 acres (2.4 ha) of leased land leased by a government, opened in 1981.[1]
